name: 4 bed detached house for sale
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Tillington, Petworth, West Sussex GU28, selling for £1,100,000 from Savills - Petworth. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Tillington, Petworth, West Sussex GU28.
complete_description: Attractive Grade II Listed character home in Tillington with views to the South Downs from a stunning landscaped garden.DescriptionTudor Cottage represents a wonderful detached home full of character on the southern side of the village of Tillington. Enjoying far-reaching views to the South Downs themselves from the rear of the house and garden which faces in a southerly direction. The property has been well cared for and enhanced during our client’s ownership and much care and attention has also been focused on the garden, which is a fabulous feature of this home.On entering the cottage from the rear into a lobby, there is a utility area to one side leading to a recently installed wet room. The lobby leads to the kitchen/dining room with its central island. A door leads to a hallway from which stems a study and access to the conservatory beyond and a dining room which in turn opens into the sitting room with its wood-burning stove. Leading from the hallway are stairs rising to the first floor and a large landing area giving access to a total of four bedrooms and a bathroom.Externally, the property is accessed via an extensive, gravelled parking area incorporating a double timber-framed car barn and leads to a detached utility and workshop adjacent to the rear of the house. The garden, with its manicured lawns separated by gravel pathways and incorporating yew and box hedging creates a sensational area from which to enjoy the fabulous views.LocationTillington is a sought after village located close to (1 mile) the market town of Petworth. It is served by a recreation ground, church and the highly regarded pub, The Horseguards Inn. Petworth, that lies at the heart of the South Downs National Park and is home to the 17th century National Trust owned Petworth House and beautiful 700 acre deer park, which is ideal for long, country walks. Petworth has a range of antique shops, independent boutiques, restaurants and delicatessens.The larger town of Haslemere just 10 miles north, offers a wider range of shops and supermarkets. Guildford in Surrey and the Cathedral city of Chichester, both with renowned theatres, are also available and have more extensive shopping and leisure facilities. The A3 provides fast access to London, the motorway network, Gatwick, Heathrow and Southampton airports.The surrounding area has much to offer with Polo at Cowdray Park, racing at Goodwood and Fontwell, golf at Cowdray Park, Goodwood, Pulborough and Liphook, motor racing at the Goodwood circuit and sailing out of Chichester Harbour and other centres along the South Coast. There are many footpaths and bridleways in the area for walking and riding.There are an excellent selection of state and independent schools in the area including Chichester High School, Bishop Luffa, Westbourne House, Prebendal, Great Ballard Seaford College, Dorset House and Midhurst Rother College.All distances and journey times are approximate.Square Footage: 2,126 sq ftAcreage:0.47 AcresDirectionsWhat3words - ///swipes.obtain.snapAdditional InfoLocal Authority: Chichester District Council, council tax band, G.Services: Mains water, electric and drainage, oil fired central heating.

name: 3 bed terraced house for sale
description: 3 bed terraced house for sale in Horder Road, Fulham, London SW6, selling for £1,150,000 from Savills - Bishops Park. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Horder Road, Fulham, London SW6.
complete_description: A charming three bedroom period property located in the desirable 'Munster Village'DescriptionThis delightful three bedroom property sits back from the quiet residential road, enclosed by a low brick wall. The house expands over three floors, providing 1,074 sqft of family living space.Upon entry, is a light-filled reception room with a period fireplace and square bay window. A wide archway seamlessly connects the reception into the kitchen, dining room at the rear. The breakfast bar overlooks the dining area, making it perfect for cooking whilst entertaining guests. Natural light floods the room through the southerly facing windows. From here you can access the low maintenance paved garden. A suntrap perfect for al fresco dining. There is potential to extend, subject to planning permissions.The first floor consists of two double bedrooms and family bathroom. The principal bedroom occupies the entire of the second floor with en suite bathroom and ample eaves storage. A peaceful sanctuary to treat to.LocationThe property is located on Horder Road, a very attractive residential road running off the southern end of the Munster Road. Horder Road is conveniently located to the Parsons Green and Fulham Road with their wealth of shops, bars, pubs and restaurants, as well as extensive transport links. To the west of the property is the open green space of Bishops Park boasting tennis courts, an urban beach, a playground and extensive footpaths running along the Thames.Horder Road is located 0.7 miles to Putney Bridge underground station and 0.6 miles to Parsons Green, running on the District Line. Please note these distances are approximates.The area has an excellent selection of nursery, primary and secondary schools including Fulham Prep, Kensington Prep and Lady Margaret's.Square Footage: 1,074 sq ft

name: 2 bed flat for sale
description: 2 bed flat for sale in Wharf Road, Gnosall, Stafford ST20, selling for £150,000 from James Du Pavey. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Wharf Road, Gnosall, Stafford ST20.
complete_description: Like a fountain sprinkles water, we are sprinkling joy in the way of offering this wonderful two double bedroom, ground floor apartment to you. Sat within the lovely village of Gnosall which has many amenities including a doctors surgery, dentist, supermarket, café, takeaway restaurants and pubs meaning you have many essentials right on your doorstep. But the other bonus with this wonderful little village is that it sits on the main bus route which takes you south westerly to the larger towns of Newport and Telford, but also east to Stafford with many more amenities and a main line train station to Birmingham and London Euston. But lets talk more about this ground floor apartment, what a little gem it is. Upon entering the main entrance to the building, the door is first on the left. In we go and are immediately greeted with a surprisingly generous entrance hallway with a large cupboard on the right which could house coats and shoes, but also a vacuum cleaner or anything else that we often tuck away out of sight! On your left the first door opens up to the second bedroom which is a lovely sized double room with some wardrobes and a window looking to the front elevation. The next door along is the lounge which is also a very good size and could comfortably hold your living room furniture along with a small dining table if you so wished and with some French doors to the side elevation, this would be a welcoming opening to the outside space on those warmer summer days. A small but pretty communal garden area is there for your enjoyment, without the hassle of having to maintain it, what a little treat! Back through the lounge and hallway and the next door is the kitchen which is a very well maintained with matching wall and base units, sink and integrated appliances which include washing machine, dishwasher, fridge and freezer along with a gas hob and oven. The next door takes you into the main bedroom which is fitted with some handy wardrobes and storage units. Finally we have the bathroom which very spacious fitted with a bath, sink unit with storage beneath and a separate shower enclosure with a mains fed shower over. This completes this lovely apartment and I would urge you to book a viewing right away as we don't think it will hang around long, opportunities like this don't come along often so hurry, book a viewing today! DirectionsFrom our Eccleshall office head down the High Street/B5026 and at the roundabout, take the third exit onto A519. Turn right onto Horse Fair/A519 and continue to follow A519 through Wootton. Turn left onto Gorse Lane. Turn left onto B5405 and turn right onto Gnosall Road which turns slightly left and becomes Knightley Road. Turn right onto Brookhouse Road and at the roundabout, take the third exit onto Station Road/A518. Turn left towards Wharf Road and the development can be found on the right hand side next to the fire station.LocationThe property is located in the rural village of Gnosall, just a short drive from Stafford, Eccleshall and Newport. Gnosall has great commuting links to the m6 and also has a variety of pubs, take aways, shops, nursery, schools, doctors and dentist. This wonderful location also boasts having plenty of country walks and also has a local playpark and outdoor gym along with tennis courts.TenureLeasehold - 125 year lease with 116 years remaining with an annual service charge of £960Leaseholders must 55 years or overAgent NoteThere is a latent defect in the separating ceiling/floor which has been acknowledged by the insurer and will be rectified under the existing insurance claim.
features:
• A ground floor apartment within easy walking access to the local amenities and the main bus route stop a short walk away to Telford or Stafford.
  • Two generous sized double bedrooms, one with fitted wardrobes & a lovely spacious bathroom with a bath, sink & separate shower enclosure.
  • A large and versatile sized lounge that could accommodate a dining table too, with French doors to the side access.
  • A small communal garden area for you to sit out and enjoy on warm days, accessed via the French doors, without the commitment of gardening!
  • Sat within the lovely village of Gnosall with a supermarket, dentist, doctors, vets, hairdresser, cafe, pubs and countryside walks.

complete_description: Beautifully appointed, two bedroom, two bathroom apartment on the ever popular Victoria Dock. Spacious, light and modern with allocated parking, double glazed throughout with beautiful views across the Half Tide Basin, the property simply must be viewed to appreciate the quality of accommodation on offer here.Victoria Dock has remained popular for so many reasons, excellent amenities, including a well regarded primary school, a well stocked convenience store, recreational areas, Riverside promenade walks, excellent road and transport links and easy access to the bustle of the city centre whilst enjoying a quieter, more suburban location.External ApproachEnjoying a prime position with views of the Half Tide Basin and the Humber beyond, the subject property is set amongst green and paved areas with mature shrubs, the car park to the rear elevation and South Bridge Road to the front elevation.Communal EntranceAccessed via solid timber doors with glazed panels to both the front and rear entrances, the communal areas are carpeted, spacious, have courtesy lighting, dark wood balustrades and stairwells to both floors, accessible meter cupboards and is managed by Pureblok management.Entrance HallwayA warm welcome awaits! Situated on the 2nd/top floor, this lovely apartment is accessed via a solid entrance door with visitor viewing lens and has the benefit of an intercom entry security system. Carpeted in neutral beige, the entrance hallway has two storage cupboards, modern profile oak doors to all rooms. Radiator.Lounge Area (4.8m x 4m (15'8" x 13'1"))A fabulous, light and airy, open space with three double glazed windows overlooking the car park and views of the Half Tide Basin and River. Three radiators ensure the heating is balanced throughout the generous living space with the addition of a wall mounted electric heater with pebble feature serving as a cosy focal point to the room. Timber effect, washed ash, laminate flooring runs seamlessly throughout the living, dining and kitchen area.Kitchen/Dining Area (3.8m x 3m (12'5" x 9'10"))Equipped with a substantial arrangement of cream, shaker style, wall and base units, with complimenting timber effect work surfaces staying faithful to the shaker style.Integrated fridge freezer, fan oven with counter sunk ceramic hob and stainless steel/glass chimney style extractor. Counter sunk, white sink and drainer with period style, half turn taps. Space and plumbing for a washing machine.Boiler housing.Gloss, black, bevelled ceramics give the arrangement an urban vibe. A window side dining area makes the very best of the water views.Bedroom One (3.98m x 2.98m (13'0" x 9'9"))Extending to 3.81 in width.A spacious, front facing, double room with double glazed window, neutral carpeting and access to the en suite.The bedroom has excellent storage with an integral storage cupboard in addition to a modern arrangement of fitted robes in a weng style surround and textured wooden effect doors. Radiator.Master En-Suite (2.25m x 1.5m (7'4" x 4'11"))Stylishly appointed with an offset quadrant shower enclosure with period concealed valve shower and fixed head. White gloss vanity set with back to wall, concealed flush WC and counter moulded sink with monobloc mixer tap. Beautiful period style radiator/towel warmer, extractor fan. Tiled in elegant, large format, brick bonded ceramics to walls with complimenting period design, tile effect linoleum flooring.Bedroom Two (3m x 2.02m (9'10" x 6'7"))A well proportioned single room with front facing, double glazed window, neutral carpeting, radiator and access to the en suite.2nd En-Suite (3m x 1.12m (9'10" x 3'8"))A well proportioned 2nd en suite making this the perfect guest room! Quadrant shower enclosure with fixed, period style head and concealed valve, fully tiled in gloss, white, bevelled ceramics.Vanity unit with semi recessed basin and monobloc mixer tap. Low level flush WC, Ornate period towel warmer/radiator. Tiled in contrasting, grey, bevelled ceramic with complimenting wood effect flooring.Council Tax BandWe have been advised that the property is Council Tax Band B.Additional InformationTenure:Leasehold - 125 years from 1 August 1990Service Charge:£1230 Per Annum paid monthly - £102.50Ground Rent:Nil Charge

description: 3 bed terraced house for sale in Neasden Grove, Bolton BL3, selling for £170,000 from Open House Nationwide. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Neasden Grove, Bolton BL3.
complete_description: This charming 3 bedroom terraced property situated in the desirable Deane area of Bolton is now on the market and ready for its new owner. Located in a prime spot between Willows Land and Wigan, the property offers excellent access to the wider area. With close proximity to Wigan Road, it enjoys direct access to Bolton Town Centre and the M61, making it ideal for those who need to commute or travel frequently.For those who prefer public transport, the area benefits from excellent bus routes, while Willows Lane offers easy access to Derby Street and St Helens Road. This property is truly in the perfect location for anyone who needs to get around easily and efficiently.In addition to its fantastic location, the property is also surrounded by a wealth of local amenities, from daily necessities to schools and parks, making it ideal for families. Everything is within easy walking distance, so you won't need to go far to find what you need.The layout of the property is thoughtfully designed and well-appointed. The ground floor boasts two spacious living rooms, a well-equipped kitchen, and a modern bathroom, making it the perfect space for relaxing and entertaining guests. Meanwhile, the first floor offers three generously sized bedrooms, all beautifully presented, and another stylish bathroom.This is a rare opportunity to purchase a stunning family home in a fantastic location. So why wait? Contact us today to arrange a viewing and see for yourself what this property has to offer!Living Room 1 (3.70m (12' 2") x 4.42m (14' 6"))The first living room is a versatile blank canvas with coloured LED lighting and two anthracite vertical radiators. Conveniently located between the downstairs bathroom and the second living room, this space is perfect for entertaining or relaxing. French doors leading to the garden provide ample natural light, creating a bright and welcoming atmosphere. With endless possibilities for personalization.Living Room 2 (3.13m (10' 3") x 5.48m (18' 0"))The second living room of this beautiful property is just as stylish and inviting as the first, with spotlighting and both vertical and horizontal anthracite radiators. Its open-plan design with the kitchen creates a seamless flow between the spaces, perfect for socializing while cooking or preparing drinks. The layout allows for maximum natural light to flood in, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. Whether for a cosy night in or a lively gathering, this space is versatile and functional.Kitchen (2.94m (9' 8") x 3.79m (12' 5"))This stunning property features a stylish and functional kitchen with marble tiles, brick effect tiled splashbacks, and white kitchen units providing ample storage space. The wood effect kitchen countertops are easy to maintain, and the built-in range master cooker and microwave are perfect for cooking and preparing meals. An extractor hood above the cooker helps keep the air clean, and the double glazed windows provide plenty of natural light. The kitchen also offers easy access to the back garden for outdoor dining and entertaining.Bathroom (2.06m (6' 9") x 0.93m (3' 1"))The ground floor bathroom in this stunning property is beautifully designed with all the necessary amenities for your comfort and convenience. It includes a modern sink, toilet, and spacious walk-in shower, perfect for starting or ending your day on a high note. The bathroom features tiled flooring and walls for a clean and sophisticated look that is easy to maintain. The double glazed frosted window allows for natural light to enter while maintaining your privacy. Ideal for guests or those seeking convenience, this bathroom impresses with its elegant and functional design, providing a comfortable and relaxing experience for all who use it.LandingThe upper level of this stunning property awaits you as you step onto the landing area. This inviting and spacious area serves as the heart of the upper level and gives access to three beautifully appointed bedrooms, in addition to the bedrooms, the landing area also grants access to the family bathroom.Bedroom 1 (2.96m (9' 8") x 3.72m (12' 2"))The first bedroom is a versatile space with neutral carpeted flooring and painted walls, allowing for complete creative freedom to personalize it to your liking. Similar in design to the rest of the house, this bedroom maintains a cohesive and harmonious feel throughout the property. Equipped with a radiator and a double glazed window for warmth and natural light, this blank canvas bedroom offers endless possibilities to create your ideal sanctuary.Bedroom 2 (2.06m (6' 9") x 3.72m (12' 2"))Similar to the first bedroom, the second bedroom also offers a blank slate design, which allows for complete creative freedom when it comes to customization. The room features a radiator to keep you warm and cosy during the colder months, and a double glazed window that lets in natural light while minimizing noise. The bedroom is a versatile space that can be transformed to reflect the style and preferences of its future owner.Bedroom 3 (1.79m (5' 10") x 3.72m (12' 2"))Similar to the other two bedrooms, the third bedroom is a blank canvas that offers endless opportunities for customization to suit the preferences and needs of its future owner. The room features a radiator to provide warmth and comfort during the cooler months and a double glazed window to allow natural light to flow in while reducing noise.Bathroom (2.00m (6' 7") x 1.69m (5' 6"))Located on the first floor, the family bathroom is a comfortable and functional space designed to cater to the needs of the entire household. With its three-piece suite consisting of a sink, a toilet, and a bathtub, this bathroom offers a relaxing and convenient experience for all. The bathroom is finished with tiled flooring and walls, giving it a clean and modern look that is both timeless and easy to maintain. The tiled walls also provide protection against moisture and prevent damage from frequent use. To ensure your comfort, the bathroom is equipped with a radiator that maintains a cosy temperature throughout the year. The double glazed frosted window provides natural light while maintaining the privacy and minimizing noise from outside.GardenThe property's garden has a pleasing mix of paved and grassed areas, providing a balance between functionality and aesthetics. The paved area is for ease, while the grassed area adds natural beauty and texture. It's a perfect option for those who want a low-maintenance garden with gardening opportunities. This garden is an excellent choice for those who want a beautiful and practical outdoor space.

complete_description: Spacious and well-presented one double bedroom first floor apartment located within walking distance to an attractive communal lake plus easy access to local amenities, bus stop and Princess Royal Hospital. The accommodation briefly comprising private entrance hallway with stairs ascending to first floor landing with window to the side, airing cupboard housing modern combination central heating boiler and two further storage cupboards, spacious lounge/diner, kitchen with a range of matching base and wall units, generous sized double bedroom with fitted wardrobe and bathroom with shower over the bath. The property benefits from gas central heating and double glazing, with parking to the front. Situated in the popular, established residential locality of Leegomery, the property is served by a range of neighbourhood facilities and primary school. It benefits from close proximity to the traditional market town of Wellington with railway station and Princess Royal Hospital whilst an excellent road network links to the modern leisure and shopping facilities of Telford Town Centre and Southwater. The property is Leasehold having 105 years unexpired with a service charge of £492 per annum and a ground rent of £10 per annum. The property is currently occupied with the Tenant paying £500 pcm rent.

name: 2 bed terraced house for sale
description: 2 bed terraced house for sale in Lismore Place, Workington CA14, selling for £60,000 from eXp World UK. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Lismore Place, Workington CA14.
complete_description: You’ve Cod To See The Potential In This Plaice. For some, living next to a chippy is an absolute non-starter. But if you can get over that, this affordable terrace that’s so close to town has all the makings of a great first home or btl.This is a great little property but for some the elephant in the room will be the fish in the fryers next door.If you really can’t see that the benefits of living next to a chippy far outweigh the negatives you may as well skip this property. Yum yum…Still reading? Good.Because this two bedroom terrace is a great blank canvas if you’re looking for an affordable first step onto the housing ladder or investment.The big, expensive stuff has been taken care of - the windows and roof are new, and the boiler is only a few years old.All that you need to do is freshen it up and put your own stamp on the property.The spacious lounge has an old gas fire that you’d probably want to rip out and replace. Or you could go all-in with a retro 1970’s theme and make a feature of it.The kitchen and bathroom are at the rear on the ground floor. Both are neat and tidy but a little dated, you’ll want to update them sooner rather than later.Having the bathroom downstairs means there’s more room on the first floor for the two bedrooms - both are good size doubles.It’s so handy for town and the bus station (it’s only a couple of streets away) but there is the potential to get a residents parking permit to allow on-street parking.It could be a perfect first time buy project. Or a tidy little investment that once freshened up with a new kitchen and bathroom could return £450 - £500pcm.If you were renting it out, it’s most likely to appeal to someone working in town, perhaps a young couple. With that in mind it’s worth knowing St Michael's Nursery and Infant School (rated "Good" by Ofsted) is less than 10 minutes walk away.If you’re looking for an affordable property with plenty of potential and can see beyond the chippy next door, this two bedroom terrace can’t be battered…er, I mean bettered!With no onward chain, if you were a cash investor or first time buyer it should be simple and straightforward to get your hands on the keys.If you’re interested in taking a look, call now to arrange a viewing, quoting reference MB0127. You could even get something to have for tea afterwards!

name: 4 bed detached house for sale
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Frogham Hill, Stuckton, Fordingbridge SP6, selling for £1,200,000 from Spencers of the New Forest - Ringwood. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Frogham Hill, Stuckton, Fordingbridge SP6.
complete_description: An immaculate, four / five bedroom detached bungalow which is set in peaceful and private grounds, within the new forest national park, just a short walk from the open forest.This property features a generous south facing rear garden, extending to 1.08 acres, as well as ample garaging and parking, well-appointed accommodation and a separate office/games room.The property:- A bright and welcoming entrance hall with feature log burner effect fire which leads into an impressive open plan kitchen/dining/snug area with doors that open out into the garden- A fully integrated kitchen with a good range of base, wall and drawer units, LED recessed plinth lights, integrated wine rack, a Rangemaster cooker with six ring gas hob and matching extractor fan over- A utility/boot room which has direct access to the garden- Triple aspect living room featuring an inglenook fireplace with log burner stove and double doors that lead out onto the patio- A contemporary, four piece family bathroom suite services bedroom two, three and four- Single bedroom five currently being used as a snug/hobby room- Bedrooms two, three and four are a generous size with a pleasant aspect over the gardens- The principal bedroom also enjoys views across the rear garden and features a three piece en suite- Home office/games room over large double garage/workshop with access from elevated balcony with views over gardenGardens and Grounds:A long gravel driveway leads up to the property with ample parking, a double garage and attached log storage. This property further benefits from a large room above the garage, ideal for a home office or games room.The gardens are beautifully maintained and landscaped with well matured trees and shrubs bordering the premises. An extensive patio area sits adjacent and to the rear of the property, ideal for alfresco dining and entertaining with a southerly aspect. There is further potential to build further garaging and storage STPP.Situation:This desirable home is situated in the beautiful village of Stuckton, which is located in the parish of Hyde and approximately 1.2 miles from the town of Fordingbridge. The market town of Ringwood is a short drive away, offering a superb range of shops, Waitrose, boutiques cafes and restaurants as well as good access via the A31 to both Bournemouth and Southampton. The larger city of Salisbury is approximately 13 miles away, offering a mainline railway station running to London Waterloo in just under 90 minutes. There are excellent schools, both state and private, in the area.Direction:Exit Ringwood along the A338 Ringwood to Fordingbridge road passing through Ibsley and the Old Beams pub, then after passing a garage turn right signposted to North Gorley and The Royal Oak pub into Lawrence Lane. At the end of this lane turn left taking you through North Gorley passing The Royal Oak pub. At the end of this lane turn right, and then left after 100 yards, onto Hyde lane. At the end of Hyde lane turn right at the T junction and the property will be found on the right.

complete_description: SummaryThis well presented double aspect Semi Detached home, can be found in the ever popular location off New Tupton. Laid with a tiled floor and double glazed windows to two sides, a door opening into the entrance hallway.Entrance HallwayThis double aspect property offers entrance doors from both the front and rear elevations of the home, with a newly fitted composite door to the rear elevation and a door to the front elevation which opens to the porch. Whilst a built in storage cupboard houses the meters and the stairs of the home rise to the first floor landing.Kitchen  9' 4" x 7' 5" ( 2.84m x 2.26m )Fitted with a range of wall base and drawer units with contrasting work surfaces over and an inset stainless steel 1 &1/2 bowl stainless steel sink and drainer with mixer tap. A built in electric oven can be found housed between the units with a gas hob over and a concealed extractor above. Space and plumbing is offered for an automatic washing machine and space is offered for a free standing fridge freezer. Whilst splash back tiling complements the walls and the floor is laid with a complementary click laminate tile. Completing the kitchen area is a rear facing PVCu double glazed window whilst an open archway gives access to the dining area.Dining Room 9' 5" x 7' 10" ( 2.87m x 2.39m )An archway from the kitchen opens to this dining area, which offers a lovely place for family dining. Fitted with a front facing PVCu double glazed window which allows an abundance of natural light within, whilst further features of the room include; coving to the ceilings, picture rail to the wall and a central heating radiator. Fitted with a PVCu double glazed window and a central heating radiator and finished with two built in cupboards offering a great space for storage.Shower RoomHaving recently being re fitted this lovely shower room offers a modern white suite which offers a vanity hand wash basin set upon a vanity unit with storage below and a double walk in shower cubicle with drying area and mains shower with double head rainfall shower. The walls of the room are completed with a complementary full tile and spot lighting can be found to the ceiling. name: Farm for sale
description: Farm for sale in Brongest, Newcastle Emlyn SA38, selling for £1,050,000 from Dai Lewis Cyf. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Brongest, Newcastle Emlyn SA38.
complete_description: Upon kind instructions of the Executors of Mr. T. G. L. Davies, deceased.A 126 acre stock rearing (former dairy) farm, with a 2/3 reception room and 5 bedroom stone/slate farmhouse, in need of various upgrading works, together with range of traditional and more modern outbuildings, set in a sheltered valley location, with a mixture of clean croppable enclosures, valley meadows and mature woodland and suiting parties wishing to acquire a larger holding or for an established business wanting to expand and located in a renowned farming community and known as:Beddgeraint, brongest, newcastle emlyn, ceredigion, SA38 9HA.Situation: Grid ref SN320 – 465The homestead is approached via a private concrete drive, with the land surrounding it on all aspects. The drive is accessed off a minor district road, leading from the direction of Brongest (1.5 miles) which has a chapel towards the direction of Glynarthen and Rhydlewis. The larger village of Rhydlewis provides for Chapel, butcher and village hall and is some 2 miles distant. The market town of Newcastle Emlyn is some 6 miles distant and has a variety of independent retail business, together with primary and secondary education and other social facilities. The Cardigan Bay coastline is within 15 minute drive of the property at Penbryn and Aberporth.Viewing: Strictly by Appointment with AgentsServices: Advised Mains electricity and water, together with various natural water resources at some points on the land. Private drainage. Oil fired central heating system. A mixture of aluminium framed and UPVC double glazed windows and external doors. Council Tax Band – ‘E’ £2080.90 (2021/22).Description: The property is a typical, traditional Welsh family 126 acre stock rearing farm, having previously had a mixed regime of Dairy/Beef/Sheep, with the land capable of growing all year grass crops and part is suited for arable cropping also. Some 109 acres can be classed as grazable and balance down to woods, track, homestead etc.The outbuildings comprise of sizable derelict stone/slate 2 storey range (roof fallen in) and other more modern ranges suited for livestock/fodder/machinery housing.The character stone/slate two storey house is of generous proportions and was erected circa 1842 according to the date tablet insert on the front wall. The property was the home farm to the former Beddgeraint Estate, which has been defunct for a considerable period of time. The house does require various upgrading works since it was last renovated in the late 1980’s we understand, and of course time has progressed since then. The house is set at the head of the yard, with hardcore parking area to its fore and sides.Accommodation: Is provided as follows:(All measurements are approximate. All rooms have coved & textured ceilings.)Glazed panel front door into:Hallway: With ceramic tiled floor, stairs to first floor, double panel radiator, telephone point, doors off to:Sitting Room: 16’10 x 15’6 with window to front, double panel radiator and 2 wall light fittings, TV point, single panel radiator and double power point, tiled surround and hearth open fireplace, with lp gas coal effect fire set within.Living Room: 17’ x 10’ with window to front, double panelled radiator, ceramic tiled floor, 2 double power points, telephone extension point, opened up inglenook area with wood burner with upright chimney pipe set on a slate hearth, door out to:Side Hall: With single panel radiator, ceramic tiled floor, glazed panel door to side exterior, door off to:Kitchen/Breakfast room: 23’ x 10’ with ceramic tiled floor, window to side, 2 Windows to rear, Stanley oil fired range (hot water/central heating/cooking), under stairs cupboard, stainlesssteel single bowl double drainer sink unit, cooker point, 4 double power points, part exposed open beam ceiling, part coved & textured ceiling, door off to:Utility: 9’1 x 6’3 with ceramic tiled floor, window to rear, 2 double power points, plumbing for washing machine, door off to:Shower Room: 7’6 x 6’2 with window to side, pedestal hand wash basin, W.C., glazed shower cubicle with ‘Regent’ unit, ceramic tiled floor.First Floor Landing: Airing cupboard, with hot water cylinder & immersion heater fitted and single power point, access to loft space, doors off to:Bedroom 1: 15’ 6 max 12’ with window to side, double panelled radiator, single power point, double power point.Bedroom 2: 10’4 x 10’4 with window to fore, double power point, single panel radiator.Bedroom 3: 10’4 x 7’5 with window to fore, single panel radiator, double power point.Bedroom 4: 13’5 x 12’1 with window to fore, double panel radiator, single power point.Bedroom 5: 10’3 x 8’5 max with window to side, double panel radiator, double power point.Bathroom: 7’9x 7’ with coloured suite of panelled bath with tiled splashback, WC, Hand wash basin set in vanity unit, single panel radiator, window to rear, shaving point and light.Externally:Concrete based entrance lane leading off the minor district road down to the homestead, with the house on one side and hardcore/grassed parking areas to both sides and small walled courtyard to its fore, with pedestrian path to the front door. To the rear is a grassed area, with plastic central heating oil tank, set on a former trailer chassis. To the front of the house is a part hardcore/concrete yard area, which gives access off to the various ranges of outbuildings.Please note that a bridleway, which is often used, comes down the entrance lane and goes down to join up with the track leading out to the neighbouring property of Cefnmaes Mawr. We note that a footpath also goes up through the woodland lying due north of the homestead and exits onto the minor district road. ( We cannot verify whether the footpath is used or not ).The Outbuildings are set out in various ranges and comprise as follows:South eastern aspect range: 45’ x 20’ concrete block and corrugated iron half round roof machinery shed/workshop with doors to both ends. 50’’ x 18’ stone /block machinery store/loose housing shed with steel main entrance door and UPVC pedestrian door. Adjoining on one end is a lean to 20’ x 18’ block/stone and corrugated iron roof workshop with 2 double power points, workbench and concrete floor.Set in the bounding field is a brick former small abattoir building, suited as an isolation pen/stable. Access from this area to the small river and crossing over to the track out to Cefnmaes Mawr and access to the northern block of woodland, with the rights of way as previously noted.South/south western aspect ranges: 87’ x 18’ stone/part block 2 storey mainly derelict cowshed/stable range with the majority of the slate roof having collapsed into the building, with the southern end of part block construction under an asbestos roof still in situ. (Subject to structural survey and planning consents, this building could provide potential for conversion to say holiday let unit/s or annexe.) Lean to 10’ wide structure to the rear of this range. Adjoining to the fore is a brick dairy 15’ x 15’.Concrete yard dividing this range away from the main modern ranges being: Block built 2 storey 38’ x 15’ former milking parlour (now used as loose box) room, tank room and loft above. Adjoining engine room. Associated collecting and dispersal yard areas.4 bay stock frame and concrete block wall with fibre concrete roof cubicle shed for 58 head with 2 scraping passages. Adjoining one side and accessed from a grass paddock and from the one end of the yard is a corrugated iron clad and block wall sides machinery shed 60’ x 22’ with earth floor. Adjoining on the other side of the cubicle shed is a 75’ x 36’ steel framed and block wall silo, under a corrugated iron roof, further adjoining 4 bay Dutch barn with lean to on front aspect width and further lean to’s of 20’ wide loose housing shed with concrete trough and further cubicle shed for 30 head.Lying along the rear of these ranges is a concrete exercise/feeding yard area with block wall boundary, with centrally located fixed fodder feeder with crash barrier sides and 2 scraping hatches to lower level part concrete and part earth wall slurry store (not currently emptied) with gateway from the bounding field for drive in access at the far end of the store. Sloping concrete scraping lip to one end of this yard (for access to tip into a rotaspreader if desired)). Concrete water trough set within the yard’s boundary wall. Gateways on both ends of the yard to access bounding fields.The Land surrounds the homestead as well as a separate block on the other side of the minor district road. Total acreage is some 126 acres or thereabouts, including the separate block of 27.39 acres.The blocks are described as follows:A.) The separate block of 27.39 acres is divided into 2 large enclosures and two smaller enclosures being level to part sloping on the western aspect. Ring boundary fenced for sheep and mains water supply crossing over from the homestead block. Three fields have been reseeded in 2021 and are in good heart.B.) 3 fields due north of the entrance lane and due west of the woodland – 29.18 acres approx. This block is level to part sloping on the southern boundary, but are suited for cropping and in general good heart. Ring boundary fenced for sheep and gateways off the district road. Field no. 9665 has a fenced off hardcore area previously used for storage of bales etc. Field No 0793 was last used for an arable crop.C.) Block due east of the homestead, beyond the river Ceri. This block totals to some 18 acres divided into three main fields and within that some 4.33 acres is classed as wood and track. The three fields are gently undulating in nature and wettish in some places and ideally suited for grazing purposes only. Two of the fields have direct access off the track leading towards Cefn Maes Mawr. Boundary fencing would need some attention – possibly more fenced towards cattle than sheep at present.D.) Block due south and west of the homestead and wooded area due north of the homestead.This area as a whole, totals to some 54 acres or thereabouts, of which some 14.31 acres is classed as wood/homestead/track etc. The pasture fields are a mixture of level to gently sloping levels, running down to meet a small river, Afon Dulais, going through the centre of the block where areas of wood also congregate. Part of the river has been fenced off. The fields would lend themselves more for grazing than cropping, as there are naturally wettish areas evident. The block of sloping mature woodland runs up behind the house up towards the plot of a derelict cottage and bounds on its eastern aspect with a small river for part of its length. (The cottage will be available for sale at a later date, as a separate entity).Iacs: The holding is registered – prospective purchasers to satisfy themselves of eligibility for future registration purposes. Some 44.45 bps entitlements would be optionally available to purchase by separate negotiation.Rights of Way: The property is sold with the benefit of all rights including rights of way, whether public or private, light support, drainage and water and electricity supplies and other rights, easements, quasieasements and restrictive covenants, all existing and proposed way leaves for masts, pylons, stays, cables, drain and water, gas and other pipes, whether referred whether referred to in these particulars or not.Directions: From Newcastle Emlyn town bridge, proceed on the B4571 towards Ffostrasol. Carry on this road and take the left hand turning signposted for Brongest. Go on to a small crossroads and turn left for Brongest and down the steep hill to the village and climb up out of the village and turn right signposted for Bettws Ifan, by the old school. Carry on until you come to the minor crossroads and turn right. Go down the hill and climb back up and as you come to a 90 degree left hand bend, the entrance to Beddgeraint will be on the right hand side with nameplate and our ‘for sale’ board erected.Beddgeraint, brongest - schedule of acreage - available on request.DisclaimerAll properties are offered for sale subject to contract and availability.We endeavour to make our sales details accurate and reliable but they should not be relied on as statements or representations of fact and they do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. The seller does not make any representation or give any warranty in relation to the property and we have no authority to do so on behalf of the seller.Services, fittings and equipment referred to in the sales details have not been tested (unless otherwise stated) and no warranty can be given as to their condition.We would strongly recommend that all the information which we provide about the property is verified by yourself or your advisers.Please contact us before viewing the property. If there is any point of particular importance to you we will be pleased to provide additional information or to make further enquiries. We will also confirm that the property remains available. This is particularly important if you are contemplating travelling some distance to view the property.

name: 5 bed property for sale
complete_address: St Ives Park, Ashley Heath BH24
description: 5 bed property for sale in St Ives Park, Ashley Heath BH24, selling for £1,150,000 from Hearnes Estate Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in St Ives Park, Ashley Heath BH24.
complete_description: A superb five bedroom detached chalet style home with a substantial annexe well positioned within its delightful, landscaped grounds of approximately 0.4 acres. The property is located on an exclusive no through road close to Ringwood Forest and The Castleman Trailway. The commuter is well provided for with nearby links to the more major towns of Poole and Bournemouth which can be accessed via the A31/A338, whilst Southampton, Winchester and London can be accessed via the A31/M27/M3. There are also mainline train stations and international airports at Bournemouth and Southampton. The property is also within the catchment for the highly regarded St Ives Primary School which has an Ofsted rating of outstanding and feeds into the Ringwood Academy.The property comprises an impressive reception hall; dual aspect fitted kitchen/breakfast room with a range of base, drawer and wall mounted units, roll top work surfaces, one and a half bowl with drainer, integrated fridge, range cooker with extractor over, tiled splash backs and ceramic tiled flooring which continues into the utility room with further storage cupboards, space and power for a washing machine, space for a tumble dryer, double glazed door to the side and windows opening onto and overlooking the side and rear gardens. A substantial sitting room with large picture window overlooking the front aspect, separate dining room with sliding patio doors giving access to the side, ground floor cloakroom, a drawing room with sliding patio doors opening onto the rear garden, luxury ground floor shower room with corner shower cubicle, wash hand basin, low level w/c and heated ladder style heated towel rail, kitchenette with single bowl and drainer, a selection of base, wall and floor units, eye level oven and microwave above, inset slim line dishwasher, integrated fridge freezer ceramic tiled floor and sliding patio doors opening onto the rear garden, ground floor bedroom four and five and a further utility/boiler room which offers space and plumbing for a washing machine and recess for a fridge of freezer.A stairway with wooden hand banister and spindles gives access to a large landing with single door access into eaves storage, storage cupboards and access to three double bedrooms, the master benefitting from an en-suite shower room and walk in dressing room. The further two bedrooms are served by the family bathroom.The front of the property is approached via a brick paviour driveway that provides extensive parking/turning with external lighting, triple arch access to the main property and recess porch to the annexe. The paviour driveway continues to give access to the side and rear gardens and integral double garage with electrically controlled rolling door.The front garden is predominately laid to lawn with stone plinths and wall to the front elevations, hedging to the side elevation and raised flower borders. The landscaped rear gardens are a particular feature of the property with its lawns, paved patio, meandering stone steps, wooden summer house with leaded light part glazed doors and windows, mature shrubs and trees all offering a high degree of privacy and seclusion.Viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the size, quality, versatility and location of the detached chalet.Council tax band: F Dorsetenergy performance certificate rating: Tbcagents notes:  The heating system, mains and appliances have not been tested by Hearnes Estate Agents. Any areas, measurements or distances are approximate. The text, photographs and plans are for guidance only and are not necessarily comprehensive and do not form part of the contract.

name: 4 bed detached house for sale
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Kemerton, Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire GL20, selling for £1,100,000 from Hughes Sealey. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Kemerton, Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire GL20.
complete_description: Welcome to Brookside Cottage, a wonderful example of a four bedroom detached Grade II listed family home, beautifully presented and located in the heart of this most sought after village. Furthermore, the home which is ready to move into and enjoy, benefits from being fully double glazed, enjoys a mature and relatively private garden measuring circa 0.7 acre as well as a detached double garage and plenty of driveway parkingThe village of Kemerton affords a real sense of community, with its two churches, a village hall, which holds several events and is home to the local playgroup, plus the public house, the Crown Inn and a village coffee house.The neighbouring village of Bredon is slightly larger and here there are further amenities to include a village shop and post office, a church, two further public houses, The Fox and Hounds and The Royal Oak. The village of Bredon also offers a rugby and football club plus a doctor's surgery and there is also a primary school. For those that play cricket, there are cricket grounds in both Westmancote and Overbury. For those needing to commute, the M5 motorway is within a 10-minute drive and provides north and southbound junctions to Birmingham and Bristol whilst within equal distance, is the A46 for those needing to access Warwick or Stratford.Returning to the property, which dates back to the 17th century, Brookside Cottage is a home that is full of period charm and character yet the current owners have added touches of modern contemporary and the two work together in complete harmony.To the front of the home is the main entrance which in turn leads to cloakroom and utility area beyond. Stepping into the main body of the home, the first room is the dining room, which in recent months, has been redecorated and new carpets fitted which continue up the stairs and landing.From the dining room, there are three doors, the first leads to the ground floor study, the second to the living room and the final door leads to the wonderfully light and spacious kitchen/garden room.The living room is separated into two area, the first, where the current owners relax of an evening, in front of wood burning stove. To the head of the living room, this space is currently designated to the music room, where double aspect windows ensure the room enjoys plenty of natural light.Completing the ground floor is the kitchen/garden room. The kitchen has been replaced in recent years and so today is a clean lined, modern range of units which is completed with Corian work surfaces and a host of integrated appliances. The garden room is a wonderful space with a full wall of glass, ensuring views over the garden can be enjoyed. To the head of the room is a set of French doors giving access to the garden and parking area whilst the roof is clear, ensuring plenty of light into the space below.Upstairs is access via two staircases, the first from the dining room leads to two bedrooms, one of which is currently being utilised as a dressing room. Completing this part of the home is the stunning four piece family bathroom which enjoys motion sensor lighting, walk in shower and a freestanding bath.The additional two bedrooms are accessed via a second set of stairs from the music room. Here are a further two doubles, both of which are double rooms. The slightly larger of the two rooms benefits from an en suite shower room.Externally the property benefits from a gravelled driveway which allows parking for four cars and in turn leads to the double detached garage. The garage features an electric roller door, light and power and access to the adjoining room beyond which could be utilised for a multitude of purposes.The garden is simply stunning, full of maturity and colour, harbouring a variety of fruit trees, as well as established shrubs and flower beds. Furthermore, there is a large lawned section, vegetable garden with greenhouse and timber shed as well as paved terracing with the garden encasing the home.In summary, a property like Brookside Cottage is a home that simply does not come onto the market very often, particularly in this highly desirable village and so, with this in mind, viewing is highly recommended.DirectionsTo locate the property, please enter the following postcode: GL20 7JL. The property is situated on your left as you turn into the lanewhat3words ///  duos.game.farmsNoticePlease note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

name: 3 bed detached house for sale
complete_address: 129C & D High Street, Forres, Moray IV36
description: 3 bed detached house for sale in 129C & D High Street, Forres, Moray IV36, selling for £130,000 from R and R Urquhart Property. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in 129C & D High Street, Forres, Moray IV36.
complete_description: Sitting in a secluded close, just seconds from the High Street, this beautiful Grade c-Listed three-bedroom stone, character house would make a wonderful family home, first time buy, or buy-to-let. Originally two houses, 129C and D have been tastefully combined to create one substantial family home on 3 floors with lots of original features such as the lovely curved staircase with wooden balustrades, the deep stone fireplace and small cellar.With a shared garden close, and an additional private garden with wonderful views towards the magnificent building of St Lawrence Church, this lovely character house is a must see. accommodationEntering through a half glazed UPVC door into a spacious hallway providing access to the sitting room, downstairs bedroom and with a beautiful, character, curved staircase leading to the upper floors. Carpet.Sitting Room (4.3m x 4.4m)A truly charming sitting room with a window facing towards the colourful close. A wood burning stove sits on a concrete hearth in a deep original stone fireplace, providing a lovely feature to the room. Bookshelves have been fitted to one wall. Carpet. Curtain pole.Kitchen (4.2m x 4.3m)A wonderfully bright, large, dining/kitchen with a wide range of modern, white, upper and lower kitchen cabinets contrasting with a light wood effect countertop. White tiled backsplash. A one-and-a-half basin with mixer tap and drainer sits beneath the window looking towards St Lawrence church. Freestanding washing machine, dishwasher, fridge/freezer. Integrated gas hob and electric oven. A deep built-in cupboard with shelves also houses the gas central heating boiler. To the front of the house a deep window seat with cupboard beneath provides a lovely nook to sit in, and a half glazed UPVC door leads towards the close.Bedroom 1 (2.0m x 3.4m)Bedroom 1 is a large single bedroom with a window facing towards the manicured lawn to the front to St Lawrence church. Lovely views of the High Street, a superb large tree and the church. Laminate floor, coat hooks. A cupboard area under the stairs, with a curtain pole and curtain, provides great storage and access to the cellar.From the hall a wonderful, curved staircase with wooden balustrades leads to the upper two floors.First floorFirst floor accommodation comprises a large double bedroom and spacious bathroom.Bedroom 2 (3.4m x 4.5m)With high ceilings and a cast iron fireplace set in a tile surround with a wooden mantelpiece, this bedroom is a lovely example of a classic, character home bedroom. A deep press cupboard with shelves provides storage and a large window facing to the close allows light to stream in. Laminate flooring. Curtains and curtain pole.Bathroom (4.4m x 2m)An extremely spacious bathroom containing a three-piece bathroom suite comprising WC, pedestal basin with tiled backsplash with wall-mounted mirror above, and bath with mains shower, wet wall surrounds and wooden bath panel. An opaque window faces towards the church with a radiator beneath. Built in shelves. Linoleum flooring.Second floorThe second floor of this wonderful house provides a superb private space with an area suitable for a desk or child play area and a separate bedroom.Bedroom 3 (4.4m x 3.3m)A large bedroom with coombed ceilings and a dormer window providing views over the adjacent rooftops to the hills and woods beyond. Views of the Black Isle are visible. Character wooden barn door. Roller blind.Study area (3.5m x 1.9m)With a window looking towards Forres High Street and a mature tree to the front of St Lawrence church, this wonderfully peaceful area would make the ideal area for a desk. Carpet.Outside129C&D High Street sits on a private close just seconds from Forres High Street. A wide pedestrian close runs along the front of the house, providing access to the adjacent homes. A private garden, currently unfenced has an area of grass with ample room for playing or growing fruit and vegetables. A large mature tree with a swing sits at the corner of the garden. Amazing views towards St Lawrence church.(Please note that all measurements given are approximate and should be treated as indicative)

name: 5 bed detached house for sale
description: 5 bed detached house for sale in Common Close, Horsell, Woking GU21, selling for £1,100,000 from Foundations Independent Estate Agent. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Common Close, Horsell, Woking GU21.
complete_description: A detached five bedroom, three bathroom family residence superbly located down a quiet tree lined cul-de-sac, within walking distance of Horsell Village, Woking Town Centre and mainline station. The property has been expertly extended and features a fabulous rear garden which backs directly onto Horsell Common.The accommodation comprises an impressive open plan 24ft x 14ft kitchen/dining room which in turn is open plan to the bespoke 20ft x 13ft conservatory enjoying lovely views over the gardens. There are two further separate reception rooms on the ground floor. On the first floor there are four double bedrooms which includes the principal bedroom with vaulted ceiling and en-suite shower room, and a separate family bathroom. The second floor consists of a further double bedroom with a separate shower room.The garden is a particular feature being approximately 100ft in length and backing directly onto Horsell Common. To the front, a horseshoe block paved driveway providing off street parting for numerous cars and leads to a sizeable integral garage. The property is offered to the market with no onward chain.Situated within easy reach of both Horsell Village and Woking Town Centre. It's much favoured mainline station offers fast and frequent links into London Waterloo in approx 24 mins, making this ideally situated for the commuter. Highly regarded schooling, stunning countryside walks not to mention fine gastro pubs, make Horsell village a firm favourite with families. The major road networks nearby include the A3, M3, M4 and M25 allowing access into central London or out to the south west of England and all major London Airports including access to Heathrow Airport and the West Country and also into the West End and City. Woking and in particular Horsell has some of the finest state and independent schools in the country. Woking is a modern and contemporary town that has been the subject of very significant improvement in recent years and in fact continues to be so. The result of this is a busy and thriving centre with a wide and eclectic array of bars, cafes and restaurants as well as a good deal of shopping opportunities not least of which is the Peacocks centre which is also home to the New Victoria theatre and multi screen cinema.

complete_address: Beverley Road, Leamington Spa, Warwickshire CV32
description: 5 bed detached house for sale in Beverley Road, Leamington Spa, Warwickshire CV32, selling for £1,250,000 from Knight Frank - Stratford Upon Avon Sales. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Beverley Road, Leamington Spa, Warwickshire CV32.
complete_description: 40 Beverley Road is an immaculately presented family home built in 1958 which has been carefully extended and renovated by the current owners to a high standard.The property is entered via a covered porch, and the front door opens into the entrance hallway with Amtico flooring, a staircase rising to the first floor, a guest cloakroom and a useful coats cupboard. Oak doors are fitted throughout, and there is copious storage in the property. The exterior render and woodwork have been recently upgraded, and internally, the house has been redecorated throughout.From the hallway, there are two different doors giving you access to the drawing room, which stretches the full depth of the house, a generous reception space with a separate games area. French doors open from each reception room to the garden. Located off the drawing room is a study with access to the garden, which is ideal for home working. A further home office, snug or playroom is accessed off the main hallway.A recently fitted contemporary kitchen has tiled flooring with underfloor heating, a large central island and bi-fold doors opening to the garden with remote-controlled electric blinds. The kitchen features Caesarstone worktops and integrated appliances, including an upright fridge/freezer, double oven, waste disposal, Quooker hot tap with filtered cold water, a cooker hood with remote control and an induction hob. Located off the kitchen is a utility room that gives access to the integral garage.The vaulted principal bedroom is certainly impressive with a Juliet balcony, fitted wardrobes, eaves cupboard and an en suite shower room. The guest room has an en suite shower room, and three further bedrooms share the family bathroom. There are two useful storage cupboards on the landing. Both shower rooms have electric underfloor heating.The front driveway provides off-road parking for several cars, and there is an integral garage. The fore garden is mainly laid to lawn with a couple of fruit trees. The large south-easterly-facing rear garden is extremely private and ideal for a family. It's mainly laid to lawn with herbaceous borders, and a generous patio stretches the width of the house, which can be accessed from any of the reception rooms.Located just off Northumberland Road, Beverley Road is a leafy wide tree-lined avenue in North Leamington Spa, just over half a mile from the town centre. Leamington Lawn Tennis & Squash Club is located around the corner from the property.There are some excellent schools within walking distance of the house, including Arnold Lodge School, Kingsley School for Girls, Trinity Catholic School, North Leamington School, Milverton and Brookhurst primary schools. Further schooling in Warwick includes Warwick Foundation Schools and Myton School.For the commuter, trains run from Leamington Spa and Warwick Parkway to Birmingham and London Marylebone. The motorway network is accessible at junctions 13,14 or 15 of the M40, with Birmingham to the north and London to the south.

description: 3 bed penthouse for sale in Rivage, Hoe Road, Plymouth PL1, selling for £1,100,000 from Lang Town & Country. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Rivage, Hoe Road, Plymouth PL1.
complete_description: Lang Town and Country are delighted to present to the market this truly fantastic and rare opportunity to acquire a top floor apartment within one of Plymouth Hoe’s most sought after developments. The Rivage apartments are a landmark development set on Plymouth's historic Hoe renowned for its breath-taking panoramic views across the famous Sound. It allows you to take in the activity both on and off the water between the Tamar and Cattewater Estuaries and beyond.The development is well positioned to enjoy all the city has to offer both on the water and nearby with a choice of marina's either side of the Hoe. Within walking distance there are a choice of restaurants, cafés in the Barbican area or slightly further out to the Royal William Yard. For those looking for Culture, the Theatre Royal is a short distance away in the city centre.The apartments, circa 2015, has been thoughtfully designed. There is a lift from the underground parking area to each floor of the building. The apartment benefits from 2 tandem parking spaces within the gated car parking area.In brief, this exceptional apartment comprises of: Entrance Hall where there is a video entry system and access to all primary rooms. There are 3 bedrooms. Bedroom 3 is currently utilised as a study/office, there are 2 further double sized rooms, both with built in storage. The master benefits from an en-suite shower room. The luxury fitted en-suite comprises a “walk in” double shower with wall mounted hand basin, low level w.c., heated ladder towel rail, large mirror, and tiled walls & floor. The fabulous family bathroom offers a bath with shower over, wall mounted sink, Low Level w.c., mirror and heated ladder towel rail. A useful utility cupboard in the hallway houses a washing machine and dryer and the boiler servicing the heating and hot water systems.Double doors lead into the spectacular and beautifully presented open plan living area. The kitchen area benefits from a variety of wall and base mounted white gloss units including a breakfast bar, where there is further storage. There are a variety of integrated “Neff” appliances namely undercounter fridge, freezer, microwave, hob, oven, and overhead extractor hood. This light and airy room is dual aspect with windows to the front and side elevation. There are French doors leading to the balcony, the views from here are simply stunning and arguably the best in the city across the Hoe Promenade, Plymouth Sound, Drake's Island, Jenny Cliff, and the Rame Peninsula Coastline.Lang Town and Country would highly encourage an internal inspection of this beautiful apartment to appreciate everything it has to offer.Agents NoteWe are advised that the owner is in the process of purchasing a share of the freehold at a cost of £10,000. name: 5 bed detached house for sale
description: 5 bed detached house for sale in Holmsley Road, Wootton BH25, selling for £1,195,000 from Spencers of the New Forest - Brockenhurst. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Holmsley Road, Wootton BH25.
complete_description: A substantial five bedroom chalet style home, situated in a sough after location, bounding the open forest. The property has been extensively and meticulously renovated over recent years to provide all the luxuries of modern living. In addition the grounds extend to about 0.9 acres and include a stable block.A substantial five bedroom chalet style home, situated in a sough after location, bounding the open forest. The property has been extensively and meticulously renovated over recent years to provide all the luxuries of modern living. In addition the grounds extend to about 0.9 acres and include a stable block.Tucked away in this wonderful forest location, the property is situated within the New Forest National Park with easy access to the villages of Brockenhurst and Sway which each offer a mainline rail connection to London Waterloo. The property also offers easy access to the A35/A337 for connections to both Southampton and Bournemouth. The popular sailing and yachting facilities of Lymington and access to the Solent is within a drive.The village of Brockenhurst lies approximately three miles away and benefits from a mainline station with direct access to London Waterloo and an extensive range of local shops, restaurants, a primary school, a popular tertiary college and the renowned Brockenhurst Golf Club. The Georgian market town of Lymington is approximately six miles away with its Saturday market and a ferry service to Yarmouth, Isle of Wight.To one side of the property is a large double garage with single up and over door and lean to dry storage to one side.To the other side of the property is a further brick built building incorporating three separate areas being workshop, storage and possible further office area.Immediately to the rear of the property is a large area of patio and leading onto the rear gardens which are laid predominantly to lawn.Further gates lead through to the middle section of the garden which have been used to create all weather putting green with adjacent fruit trees.To one side of the property is an enclosed chicken coop, kitchen garden with raised beds and a further gate leads to the stableyard and the timber stableblock.To the rear of this is a small area of holding paddock.

description: 2 bed terraced house for sale in Whitehouse Lane, Walkley S6, selling for £170,000 from Hunters - Hillsborough. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Whitehouse Lane, Walkley S6.
complete_description: Hunters Hillsborough are delighted to present a generously proportioned two bedroomed mid terrace property situated in the ever popular district of Walkley. This immaculately presented home has undergone a full scheme of modernisation over the past few years, including insulation throughout, new boiler, electrics, new doors and windows including internal doors, newly fitted kitchen and bathroom. This is an excellent opportunity for investors, couples and growing families due to the location and viewing is highly recommended. Entry to the property via the front door into the lounge with neutral décor. Door through to the inner lobby with stairs rising to the first floor. Family breakfast kitchen with a good range of modern fitted wall and base units, integrated appliances include an induction hob, electric oven and a microwave with space for a free standing fridge freezer and washing machine. Access to the cellar and a door leading out to the rear garden. Upstairs is an impressive wood and metal balustrade across the landing. Bedroom one is a good size double, further double bedroom and a handy walk in area which, with a window and door fitted this could easily be turned into a usable office/bedroom. Access to the loft space from this room. Shower room with sink basin, W/C and a large walk in shower. Outside the property enjoys an enclosed lawn area.Local AreaIdeally located and within walking distance of good local schools. Just a short stroll to South Road, Walkley's main shopping area. Close to the Sheffield Supertram Network.General RemarksTenureThe property is FreeholdRating assessmentWe are advised by the Local Authority that the property is assessed for Council Tax Band A.Mortgage facilitiesWe should be pleased to advise you in obtaining the best type of Mortgage to suit your individual requirements.Your home is at risk if you do not keep up repayments on A mortgage or other loans secured on it.

description: Land for sale in Cairnhill, Rosehearty AB43, selling for £58,000 from Stewart & Watson. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Cairnhill, Rosehearty AB43.
complete_description: Plot B, cairnhill, roseheartyBuilding plot with planning permission to build 4 bedroomed family homesOffers Over £58,000 Second similar sized plot available A rare opportunity to look into building your dream home Coastal village location Coastal and village views Planning permission reinstated in 2021GeneralWe offer for sale a well-proportioned triangular shaped plot at approximately 2200 sq/m in the vibrant coastal village of Rosehearty.The planning permission is for a good sized family home and accommodation comprises four bedrooms, the generous sized master bedroom benefitting from his and hers walk in wardrobes and en suite facilities, the kitchen is open plan with a family room, there is a lounge, utility room, bathroom, shower room, store room and ample wardrobe and cupboard space. There would also be a double sized garage with two doors allowing for two cars.The plot is situated on high ground and therefore offer spectacular views of the village below, the rolling countryside, cliffs and out to the North Sea.A second rectangular shaped plot is also available.Planning permissionFull detailed planning permission to build and develop these generous sized 4 bedroomed houses with garages has been granted.Full details of the permission can be found on the Council’s website under reference number app/2017/3172.Both plots will benefit from spectacular coastal views.ServicesDrainage will require to be by septic tank. A mains water supply flows nearby but it will remain the purchasers responsibility to ensure that all services are available and to obtain satisfactory estimates for full installation however deeds of service are in place.ViewingCall at siteEmailOffersAll offers should be submitted in writing to our Fraserburgh officeLocationThis site is located at the edge of the Village of Rosehearty. On entering the village, head through the square and follow Pitsligo Street and near the end of Pitsligo Street, take the left heading to Cairnhill Road. Follow the paved road which leads directly to the two plots.The village of Rosehearty has a Primary school, award winning hotel, a popular golf course, a post office/butcher shop, spar and other amenities. The beach and various walking trails are popular with many people.Reference nh/va

The guide price or range of guide prices is given to assist consumers in deciding whether or not to pursue a purchase. It is usual, but not always the case, that a provisional reserve range is agreed between the seller and the auctioneer at the start of marketing. As the reserve is not fixed at this stage and can be adjusted by the seller at any time up to the day of the auction in the light of interest shown during the marketing period, a guide price is issued. This guide price can be shown in the form of a minimum and maximum price range within which an acceptable sale price (reserve) would fall, or as a single price figure within 10% of which the minimum acceptable price (reserve) would fall. A guide price is different to a reserve price (see separate definition). Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.Reserve PriceThe seller’s minimum acceptable price at auction and the figure below which the auctioneer cannot sell. The reserve price is not disclosed and remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer.Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.

description: 2 bed terraced house for sale in Craddock Street, Wolverhampton, West Midlands WV6, selling for £95,000 from Dixons Estate Agents - Wolverhamptons Sales. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Craddock Street, Wolverhampton, West Midlands WV6.
complete_description: Two bedroom mid terrace house situated in residential location within 1.2 mile of Wolverhampton city centre offering no upward chain.Property is offered for sale through the Modern Method of Auction which is operated by iamsold Limited. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc. VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change.This home retreat is close to all sorts of amenities, including; shops, schools, colleges and leisure facilities, with further benefits such as public transport available via bus, rail and metro.This freehold residence presents a ready made home solution suitable for a variety of buyer types. In brief, the accommodation comprises; entrance hallway, dining room, lounge, kitchen, inner lobby, bathroom and two double bedrooms.The property is further benefitting from; gas central heating, double glazing, fenced rear courtyard and separate rear garden.All interested parties are strongly encouraged to contact us at their earliest opportunity to avoid dissapointment.
