Easy reach of park facilities and the beach.Site: Park Holidays UK.Site facilities: This holiday park offers many facilities which include a swimming pool, sauna, Jacuzzi and gym. There is also a bar and restaurant on site and a selection of activities for all ages. Practical facilities such as a Launderette are also available.Beach: The Park has its own direct beach access.Security: Entrance is only granted via a key fob (or on confirmation of a booking). The entire park is fenced and has CCTV active in prominent areas of the park.Accommodation:Gated access to side decked area with UPVC obscure double glazed door to:Open plan kitchen/dining/livingroom: 18'02 x 11'10 (5.5m x 3.6m).Kitchen/diner: UPVC double glazed windows to sides and front. Fitted oven with hob over and splashback with extractor fan above. Floor and wall cupboards with work surface over. Stainless steel sink with hot and cold mixer tap. Wall shelving housing microwave. Fridge freezer. Storage cupboard housing boiler. Dining table. Smoke and carbon monoxide detectors.Lounge: L shape sofa with pull out double bed. TV unit. Electric fire with surround. Mirror on wall. Radiator.Door to:Hallway: Doors to:Bedroom one: 9'02 x 10'00 to wardrobe (3.6m x 2.6m). UPVC double glazed window to side. Vanity shelving unit and stool. Fitted shelving and cupboards. Two fitted wardrobes. King size bed with 2x bedside units and headboard. Radiator. Door to:En-suite WC: 4'02 x 3'05 (1.2m x 1.4m). UPVC double glazed window to side. Low level wc. Pedestal wash hand basin with mixer tap. Mirror on wall. Radiator. Cupboard housing boiler.From hallway doors to:Bedroom two: 8'02 x 5'06 (2.5m x 1.6m). Twin beds with bedside unit. Fitted wardrobe. Radiator. Mirror on wall. UPVC double glazed window to side.Shower room: 6'11 x 3'06 (2.1m x 1.8m). Glass sliding door into shower cubicle, fitted mains shower with hot and cold mixer taps. Lower level wc. UPVC double glazed obscure glass window to side. Sink with hot and cold mixer taps. Mirror. Extractor fan. Radiator. Shelving on wall.Outside: Decking. Parking space. Outside storage unit.Outgoings (as advised by the current owner but should be verified with Pevensey Bay Holiday Park, as fees are subject to change once new contracts are agreed).2022/2023 season:Pitch fee's: £7,595 (subject to increase/annual review by the holiday park upon new ownership)insurance: Compulsory - (price varies depending on holiday home size etc.) To be paid by the caravan owner via the holiday park, however, upon pre approval by the park private insurance can be obtained.Piped gas, electric, water and rates: These are paid separately.Licence period: 12 years remaining - 21/06/2035 (to be verified & confirmed by Park Holidays UK).Sub letting: Scheme is availablesite opening times: The holiday park is open to owners for eleven & half months of the year from 1st March to 14th February.Additional information:Nb: To be used as a holiday home only, not residential.*Please note then when enquiring about this lodge or any others at Pevensey Bay Holiday Park, your details will be shared with Park Holidays UK, as we operate as an introducing agent only and all guests to the site must be registered for security purposes and referral purposes.EPC: N/alocation and map: Eastbourne Road is within close proximity of the beach at Pevensey Bay an approximately 1/4 mile from the village High Street with its local amenities. Pevensey Bay is a seaside village with the advantage of a mainline rail service with direct links to Hastings and London as well as a local bus service to Eastbourne town centre with its major shops and entertainments being approx. 5 miles distant. Sovereign Harbour and the crumbles retail park is also approx. 1 mile distant. Access to A22, A27 and A259.Agents notes:Note for potential buyers: Please note, that although we can negotiate offers and terms between our vendor and a potential buyer, we are unable to confirm a sale or consider removing any property from the open market until we have been able to report to our client that a buyer can proceed. In order to do so, all buyers are requested to provide to us, as soon as possible, full correspondence details, photographic and residential id, proof of funds and/or proof of proceed-ability (ie. Financial advisor's details, selling agents details, copies of cash availability in the form of bank account or savings statements, and/or mortgage agreement in principle). We will also require solicitors' details. Offers received, subject to selling, will still require the same verifications. All final decisions, regarding offers and terms, remain with the vendor. Should you have any queries at any time about this process, please call a member of our sales team to discuss.In accordance with The Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations 2008 (cpr's), masonbryant have prepared these sales particulars for general guidance purposes only. They do not form part of any offer or contract. masonbryant have not carried out a structural survey of the property or tested any apparatus, equipment, fittings, or services, so cannot verify that they are in working order. The buyer is advised to obtain verification from their solicitor or surveyor regarding boundaries, rights of way etc. For which the agent cannot be held responsible. Items shown in photographs are not necessarily included in the sale. Room measurements, photographs and floorplans are given for guidance purposes only and should not be relied upon when ordering such items as furniture, appliances, and carpets. Measurements mostly indicate the approximate maximum dimensions of any room and can include window bays, wardrobe cupboards and recesses. We often use wide angle photography enabling more of the room or subject to be seen in one shot. The results might, in some situations, suggest the room/subject is larger than it is. We have not checked the legal documents to verify the freehold/leasehold status of the property. Lease details, service charges and ground rent (where applicable) if supplied are given as a guide only and should be checked and confirmed via a solicitor.Gdpr - how we handle your personal data: We take our data privacy responsibilities very seriously at masonbryant, and endeavour to ensure that we provide you with information about how and why we use your personal data, how long we hold onto your data, who we share it with and your rights in relation to access, redress and deletion of your data under gdpr (general data protection regulations effective 25th may 2018). Our privacy policy explains this and sets out the rights you have in relation to your personal data. If you would like to find out more about how we handle, use and store your data, you can read our privacy policy on our website at request a copy of our guide to handling your personal data or speak to one of the directors at any time.Services to clients and disclosure of referral fees: Upon request, we may offer referrals to 3rd party services such as legal advice and conveyancing, financial services (including mortgages and insurance) and other property services such as local surveyors etc. By doing this, we may be entitled to receive a referral fee, by law we must make you aware of this. Our average referral fee payment from one of these suppliers is £100.00 + vat (£120.00 including vat).Please note: The full EPC (Energy Performance Certificate) is available for all our properties upon request.Maps: As taken from Google maps. Copyright Google.

complete_description: Looking for a cozy bungalow? Modern, immaculately presented and with a south-facing rear enclosed garden, then look no further. Nestled in a very quiet residential estate with no through road we have for sale number 2 Brynglas, Penygroes. A lovely little bit of curb appeal greats you on arrival with an open-aspect frontage and driveway offering ample parking while internally the property has a beautiful flow that takes you to a very pleasing garden. Why don't you book a viewing today on and take a peek at this little treat! EPC rating E (this is not a true representation of the current EPC as upgrades have been made)Accommodation comprises of : Vestibule, lounge/diner, kitchen, inner hallway, modern shower-room and two bedrooms. Externally we have an open-aspect frontage mainly laid to lawn with driveway to the side. To the rear, an enclosed south-facing garden with a mixture of patio and lawn and wooden garden shed.The property is situated within the village of Penygroes convenient to local facilities including retail shops, primary school, Post Office, village public houses, and places of worship. It is within 2mls distance of the expanding center of Cross Hands where a wider range of facilities are available including Retail shops, Cinema, Dental and Medical Centres, gymnasium and also several multi-national superstores. At Cross Hands, there is the ease of access on to the A48/M4 dual carriageway with good road links to the towns of Carmarthen (approx.11mls), Llanelli (approx.9mls), Ammanford (approx.7mls), Llandeilo (approx.10mls), and the City of Swansea (approx.18mls).Porch (1.08 x 1.21 (3'6" x 3'11"))Living Room (5.06 x 3.64 (16'7" x 11'11"))Kitchen (3.37 x 2.12 (11'0" x 6'11"))Hallway (2.04 x 0.88 (6'8" x 2'10"))Bathroom (2.73 x 1.62 (8'11" x 5'3"))Bedroom One (3.53 x 3.13 (11'6" x 10'3"))Bedroom Two (2.34 x 2.62 (7'8" x 8'7" ))

complete_description: ** chain free ** Situated in a cul de sac, walking distance to the main town centre is this 17th Century, Grade II listed, historic fisherman's cottage, boasting character throughout, set across 3 floors, featuring 3/4 bedrooms, a cast iron log burner and sizeable sitting room!SummarySituated in a cul de sac, walking distance to the main town centre and other local amenities is this 17th Century, Grade II listed, historic fisherman's cottage, boasting character throughout, set across 3 floors, featuring 3 bedrooms with the potential for a 4th, a cast iron log burner, sizeable sitting room, kitchen diner and fully enclosed rear garden. Coming offered to you chain free!LocationThis home is located in an English coastal town that is situated on the edge of the Norfolk broads; it is the most easterly point of the British Isles. Home to Blue Flag award winning sandy beaches with stunning and historical Victorian seafront gardens, the Royal Plain Fountains, two piers and independent eateries. There are a number of fantastic schools in the area to suit all ages, A Bus Station and Train Station which both run regular services to Norwich and surrounding areas. Lowestoft is 110 miles north-east of London, 38 miles north-east of Ipswich and 22 miles south-east of Norwich.Sitting Room (4.4 max x 3.8 (14'5" max x 12'5"))Timber window with secondary glazing and entrance door to the front of the property, tile flooring throughout, door opening to a storage cupboard, electric radiator, cast iron log burner within an original brick surround and door opening to a lobby area.Inner Hall/Study (3.4 x 1.1 (11'1" x 3'7"))Tile flooring throughout and doors opening to the kitchen/diner and stairs leading to the first floor.Kitchen/Diner (4.3 x 2.5 (14'1" x 8'2"))Timber sash window with secondary glazing and entrance door to the rear aspect, tile flooring throughout, part tile walls, electric radiator, laminate work surfaces, stainless steel sink with drainer and space for appliances including a fridge/freezer and electric oven, door opening to a built in cupboard.Landing/Bedroom 4Original wood flooring throughout, decorative window to the front aspect, curtains opening to a storage area and hot water cylinder. Doors opening to stairs leading to the master bedroom and bedrooms 2-3.Bedroom 2 (4.3 x 3.3 (14'1" x 10'9"))Timber sash with with secondary glazing to the front aspect, original wood flooring throughout, feature ceiling beams and electric radiator.Bedroom 3 (2.7 x 2.5 (8'10" x 8'2"))Timber window to the rear aspect with secondary glazing, carpet flooring throughout, electric radiator and door opening to the bathroom.Bathroom (2.3 x 1.5 (7'6" x 4'11"))Timber window to the rear aspect, carpet flooring throughout, tile walls, toilet, pedestal wash basin and bath with electric shower above.Stairs Leading To The Second FloorBedroom 1 (4.6 x 4.1 max (15'1" x 13'5" max))Timber double glazed window to the front aspect, original wood flooring throughout, feature beams and electric radiator.OutsideTo the front of the property a shared alley leads to access into the rear garden and entrance into the property via the kitchen/diner.To the rear of the property a level timber gate opens to a fully enclosed patio garden with shrubs and x2 doors opening to a brick built outhouse with water and outside WC.Agent NoteThe property is Grade II listed and uses a pre-paid electric meter.Financial ServicesIf you would like to know if you can afford this property and how much the monthly repayments would be, Paul Hubbard Estate Agents can offer you recommendations on financial/mortgage advisors, who will search for the best current deals for first time buyers, buy to let investors, upsizers and relocators. name: 5 bed detached house for sale
description: 5 bed detached house for sale in Highland Road, Kenilworth, Warwickshire CV8, selling for £1,100,000 from Fine & Country - Leamington Spa. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Highland Road, Kenilworth, Warwickshire CV8.
complete_description: The Graylands, is a remarkable home originally built in the 1960s by an architect who lived in it until 2014 and has been fully renovated and extended to an exceptional and immaculate standard in 2016 to double the original size of the property and is ready for a discerning buyer to move in. (This truly is a turnkey property !) With a large brick paved driveway that can accommodate up to 4-5 cars, electric dual port vehicle charger, entrance porch, downstairs toilet, and further grand entrance hallway with stunning vaulted ceiling and spacious lounge with a multifuel stove and air source heat pump for heating and cooling, this home is perfect for any stage of life. The dining room and kitchen run the length of the house with high-quality fittings, porcelain tiled flooring, painted oak shaker style units with granite worktops and a central island. There is also a further reception room which could be used as a study, gym or downstairs double bedroom with an en-suite making the house a six-bedroom four-bathroom property.The upstairs of the property is a luxurious retreat with five bedrooms and three bathrooms, featuring a spacious principal bedroom with a beautiful roofline ceiling, 2x Velux windows, and an Air Source Heat pump for heating and cooling. You can take in the beautiful views of the landscaped garden through the large aluminium bi-fold doors. The ensuite bathroom is equally impressive with a heated floor, dual fuel towel rail, and an integrated shower. The family bathroom also boasts the same features and a separate shower. There are four more bedrooms including an even larger front double bedroom with another featured roofline ceiling, and another bedroom including an ensuite bathroom.To the rear, the outside of the property is equally impressive, with a patio stretching across the full width of the property finished with block paving and a rendered retaining wall. Integrated steps and slope lead up to a good-sized lawn, with a screened off shed and vegetable garden area providing the perfect space to relax, entertain and enjoy the outdoors.Tenure: Freehold | EPC: C | Tax Band: FFor more information or to arrange a viewing, contact Sarah Garland at Fine & Country Leamington Spa

name: 4 bed detached house for sale
complete_address: Matford Avenue, St. Leonards, Exeter EX2
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Matford Avenue, St. Leonards, Exeter EX2, selling for £1,200,000 from Strutt & Parker - Exeter. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Matford Avenue, St. Leonards, Exeter EX2.
complete_description:
This beautifully-presented family home which is set back from the road in a very desirable street in Exeter, offers light-filled accommodation. The property benefits from an attached self-contained annexe which currently provides opportunities for either multi-generational living or guest accommodation. The house features high ceilings and elegant styling throughout and has a large rear south facing garden with useful outbuildings.The ground floor reception rooms have wooden parquet flooring and large windows welcoming a wealth of natural light. The generous L-shaped sitting room has a woodburning stove, full-height windows and a door opening onto the rear garden. The spacious formal dining room adjoins the kitchen in a semi open-plan layout. The kitchen has plenty of storage in fitted units to base and wall level, a butler sink, an integrated oven and hob and an Aga. The property benefits from a large utility room providing further space for storage and appliances. The ground floor accommodation is completed by a useful office space and a downstairs cloakroom.There are four well-presented double bedrooms on the first floor, including the well-proportioned principal bedroom, which has built-in storage and a dual-aspect allowing for plenty of natural light. The first floor also has a family bathroom with a bath and separate shower unit as well as an additional shower room.The annexe is self-contained with its own entrance and includes a comfortable sitting/dining room with French doors onto the rear garden, a fully equipped kitchen, one bedroom and a bathroom with a bath and an overhead shower.Local Authority: Exeter City CouncilServices: Mains electricity, gas, water and drainageCouncil Tax: Band FWayleaves and Easements: The property is sold subject to any wayleaves or easements, whether mentioned in these particulars or notTenure: FreeholdGuide Price: Offers in excess of £1,200,000

At the front of the house there is an area of well-maintained lawn with border hedgerow and a paved pathway leading to the front of the property as well as parking space for up to two vehicles. The sizeable rear garden extends to more than 100ft and is south facing welcoming plenty of sunlight throughout the day. The garden is mainly laid to lawn and includes a variety of established shrubs, hedgerow, mature trees and border flowerbeds as well as a gravel pathway that leads to the two garden sheds. There is also a large area of paved terracing providing ideal space for al fresco dining and entertaining.

Matford Avenue is a quiet road situated in the heart of St Leonards conservation area, being one of the most favoured residential areas of the Cathedral and University City of Exeter. The property enjoys a convenient location for the nearby Magdalen Road which has a “village feel” and is well known for its selection of quality independent food and gift shops, restaurants, pub and cafes. St Leonards also benefits from a number of excellent private and state schools such as Exeter School, The Maynard and a very sought-after primary school. The hospitals, Waitrose supermarket and John Lewis are all within easy reach. The property is around half a mile from the city centre which offers an abundance of shopping and eateries. Exeter affords superb sports and leisure facilities, an expanding College (rated outstanding by ofsted) and Exeter University is rated as one of the best in the country. As well as a selection of theatres, cinemas, a museum, cathedral, leisure centres and a football club, there is also Exeter Chiefs, who are one of the UK’s top rugby teams. The River Exe and its historic Quayside and canal which is also bustling with restaurants and cafes is close by. Cyclingroutes to the popular seaside towns of Dawlish and Exmouth beyond are on the doorstep. Exeter was recently named as one of the 20 best places in the country to live by the Sunday Times, labelling the capital of Devon ‘a glorious gateway to the west’. A perfectly positioned city, it has two national parks and plenty of scenic coastline locally. Exeter St. David’s railway station links to London Paddington in about two hours and Exeter International Airport provides an ever-increasing number of domestic and international flights. The M5 motorway at Exeter provides easy access to Bristol and London as well as easy links to the A38 to Plymouth or the A30 to Cornwall.

  • A one-bedroom self-contained Annex with a separate sitting/dining room, kitchen and bathroom

description: 6 bed detached house for sale in Prospect, Corsham SN13, selling for £1,250,000 from Strakers - Corsham. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Prospect, Corsham SN13.
complete_description: This handsome country house was built in about 1910 at a time when it was located in the countryside - since when Corsham has expanded although the long drive and private grounds retain much of the character of its original setting. The accommodation is generous with the principal rooms facing south and overlooking the large lawn; the gardens are a delight with more formal areas extending into a woodland garden to one side.SituationCorsham is a pretty and historic town of architectural significance located on the southern fringes of the Cotswolds, an area of outstanding natural beauty and some 8 miles North East of the fine Georgian City of Bath. The town, noted for its fine High Street, has a wealth of beautiful and historic buildings dating from the 16th Century such as the Alms House and the historic Corsham Court with its landscaped open parkland. The town caters for most day to day needs with a range of national and bespoke shops, coffee houses, boutiques, restaurants and a variety of public houses. There are very good Primary and Secondary schools and the new Corsham Leisure Centre. Communications are excellent: Bath, Bristol and Swindon are all within easy motoring distance; there are fast road links to London and the West Country via the M4 motorway (J17 and 18 approximately 15 - 20 minutes away); and main line rail services are available from either Bath or Chippenham to Bristol Temple Meads and London Paddington.Agents NotesAgents note:1/ There is a proposal to develop the adjoining field to the south subject to planning permission being granted (this is in the ownership of the vendors and demarked on the plan above by a broken blue line). Access to Dicketts is by way of a right of way across the drive hatched brown. There will be a covenant not to construct any additional dwellings on Dicketts for a period of five years from completion of its purchase.2/ The property is currently connected to a private drainage system which is in the adjoining land. The purchaser of Dicketts will be granted a licence to use the existing system for a maximum period of twelve months from completion to allow time for the purchaser to install an alternative system within the grounds of Dicketts.Further details are available from the agents.Property InformationTenure: Freehold.Services: Mains Gas, Water & Electricity. Private drainageCouncil Tax: Band GEPC rating E

complete_description: Tenant in situ at the property.buy to let purchase only. Looking for an investment property then look no further. We have a detached bungalow ideally located on the outskirts of the market town of Ammanford. Within easy reach of the town's amenities and access routes to the M4/A48 corridor.The accommodation comprises of entrance hallway lounge, kitchen, three bedrooms, and a bathroom.Externally the Front garden is enclosed by a low wall with side access to the rear garden, off-road parking, and garage.Ammanford is one of the first Carmarthenshire towns you encounter when driving in from the east, situated within striking distance of the Brecon Beacons National Park and its atmospheric Black Mountain. Look out for 'Y Twrch Trwyth', the wild boar that none other than King Arthur and his knights are said to have hunted on the slopes of the Amman Valley; the beast can be seen on historical trail boards and sculptures around Ammanford. More contemporary legends from the area include rugby hero Shane Williams, the flying winger who has played for The Ospreys, Wales and the British Lions, and Alex Jones, co-presenter of The One Show.Kitchen (3.51 x 2.40 (11'6" x 7'10"))Living Room (4.45 x 3.23 2.743 (14'7" x 10'7" 8'11" ))Bedroom One (3.95 x 2.93 (12'11" x 9'7"))Bedroom Two (1.88 x 2.92 (6'2" x 9'6"))Bedroom Three (1.88 x 2.92 (6'2" x 9'6"))Bathroom (2.14 x 1.71 (7'0" x 5'7"))

description: 1 bed flat for sale in All Saints Road, Sidmouth EX10, selling for £86,000 from Harrison Lavers & Potburys. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in All Saints Road, Sidmouth EX10.
complete_description: A unique opportunity to purchase the only studio apartment at this popular development that would serve as an ideal, private holiday home for family and friends. Close to the town centre and a few hundred yards from the seafront.SummaryLocated on the second floor but with lift access, this studio apartment is presented in good modern order throughout with triple and double glazing and electric heating. The property has been a permanent home but could also suit those seeking a holiday home. A small entrance hall has overhead storage and leads into the sitting room/bedroom. Particular features of the room are the high ceiling and the west facing window with views over the delightful grounds. There is also a night-storage heater.A door from the sitting room leads into a light and airy, modern kitchen/breakfast room with a remotely controlled, triple glazed Velux skylight. There are a good range of modern units, a breakfast bar and fitted Bosch electric oven and hob. There is a freestanding fridge and dishwasher, both included in the sale. Between the kitchen/breakfast room and the shower room is a small inner hallway with fitted shelving and an airing cupboard with further shelving and a modern electric water heater. The shower room is fitted with a modern suite, mirrored wall units, a chrome electric towel heater, under floor heating and a remotely controlled, triple glazed Velux skylight.OutsidePowys House stands in attractive communal grounds of around four acres with a large lawn garden, having a south facing aspect and tree lined boundary. Owners benefit from a laundry, spacious lounge, greenhouse, reading areas, guest suites and a full time house manager.LocationThere is residents/visitor parking and pedestrian access via Connaught Close, providing a convenient walk through to All Saints Road and onto the town centre. The seafront is approximately a third of a mile away. Sidmouth offers an excellent range of amenities that include numerous independent shops and High Street chains, regular buses to the surrounding area, a cinema, theatre, Waitrose, Lidl and sports clubs including rugby, cricket and golf.TenureWe understand that the apartment is leasehold and held on a 999 year lease from 1982.MaintenanceThere is a service charge for each apartment at Powys House, which is payable monthly in advance and covers the following items: The House Manager’s salary, the maintenance, repair and re-decoration of building structures and communal area facilities, maintenance of the laundry and its equipment and the two guest suites (which are available at a nominal cost for the use of the residents’ visitors), all external window cleaning, gardening, the cost of the water, gas and electricity for the communal areas (where applicable), buildings insurance plus contents insurance for the common areas, furnishing and equipment. The management charge for administration purposes is levied by the Housing Association or their agent in line with the housing corporation guidelines. The current service charge is £339.72 per month (correct March 2023). Service charge payments can be liable to alteration, you should therefore, check the position before making a commitment to purchase.Agents NotesA resident must be 55 years of age or over. The lease contains specific arrangements for the re-sale of apartments. Re-sales are conducted on the seller’s behalf by the freeholder, Retirement Properties Ltd. The arrangements for the fees and costs which apply to this process have been amended by voluntary agreement with the Competition and Markets Authority. The sellers will be responsible for the fees to the estate agent, solicitor and any other costs such as the EPC, and in addition a fee calculated at 4% of the lower of the sale price or the sellers original purchase price, is payable to the freeholder.OutgoingsWe are advised by East Devon District Council that the council tax band is A.EPC: DPossessionVacant possession on completion.Ref: Dhs01923DirectionsFrom the top of the High Street, turn left into All Saints Road. At the roundabout take the third exit which is the entrance to Powys House.ViewingStrictly by appointment with the agents.Important NoticeIf you request a viewing of a property, we the Agent will require certain pieces of personal information from you in order to provide a professional service to both you and our clients. The personal information you provide may be shared with our client, but will not be passed to third parties without your consent. The Agent has not tested any apparatus, equipment, appliance, fixtures, fittings or services and so cannot verify that they are in working order, or fit for the purpose. A Buyer is advised to obtain verification from their solicitor and/or surveyor. References to the tenure/outgoings/charges of a property are based on information supplied by the seller - the Agent has not had sight of the title documents. A Buyer is advised to obtain verification from their solicitor. Items shown in photographs/floor plans are not included unless specifically mentioned within the sale particulars. They may be available by separate negotiation. Buyers must check the availability of any property and make an appointment to view before embarking on a journey to view a property.

complete_description: Pearson Keehan are excited to bring to the market this lovely four/five bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a very sought-after area in Hove. Spanning over three floors with an abundance of charming features throughout, the property is beautifully presented and enjoys a generously sized rear garden and off-street parking.Stepping inside this spacious home, you are immediately greeted with stripped wooden floorboards, high ceilings and period features. The property measures close to 1,800 sq ft and has well-appointed accommodation. Starting with the ground floor, you have a wonderfully cosy bay-fronted living room with open fire place. Stripped bi-folding wooden doors provide access from the living room to the dining room. To the rear of the ground floor, you have the large kitchen/breakfast room with granite worktops, which leads to a shower room, utility room and conservatory.Moving upstairs to the first floor, three double bedrooms are found along with one single bedroom, currently set up as a home office. You also have a family bathroom and separate WC. Completing the accommodation on the second floor is a further bedroom and a beautifully finished bathroom with roll top bath and luxury separate shower.The property boasts a large rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn with mature planting and a small decked area. To the front of the house, you have a block-paved driveway to enable off street parking.In terms of location, Glebe Villas lies south of Portland Road and is conveniently located close to numerous local amenities including coffee shops, restaurants and supermarkets. Furthermore, the property provides easy access to a number of excellent local schools and Portslade Station is just around the corner providing direct trains to London, Gatwick and Brighton, making this home ideal for families and commuters alike.Guide Price - £1,000,000 - £1,100,000Council Tax Band: E

complete_description: A spacious and well-presented farmhouse with an annex and two large stone barns set in 3 acres, located in the picturesque Holme Lacy area of Herefordshire.Caldicott Farm is pretty, unlisted and has been a wonderful family home for many years.Within the grounds there are two stone barns that have planning to develop into residential homes (planning permission approved - Ref: P203543/F) with sizeable gardens and far reaching views across the countryside.The main house benefits from four large reception rooms, with the main sitting room having a large and imposing stone fireplace and log burner. A large kitchen with slate flooring that links into the dining room.Upstairs there are four double bedrooms and two bathrooms each window upstairs has views as far as the eye can see.A large garden to the rear of the house with access to a separate timber framed barn with a triple car port and stable. There is ample off road parking.LocationCaldicott Farm is located between Hereford & Ross on Wye, it has convenient access to major road networks including the A40 & M50/M5.There are several prominent and sought after schools located close by including Little Dewchurch and the renowned Steiner Academy in Much Dewchurch.Local amenities, doctors surgeries and local pubs are not too far away. Leisure facilities can be found at Rotherwas Business Park and Wye Leisure in Fownhope.Many of the counties attractions are within a short drive, these include the Black Mountains, River Wye and Hereford Cathedral.BarnFurther plans can be found by visiting Planning Application Number: P203543/F (approved)Fruit Barn-------------Offering close to 3,200 sq ft over two floors and would incorporate a large open plan kitchen/dining room, living room, snug, utility room and a WC.Upstairs there would be four double bedrooms, two en-suite shower rooms and a family bathroom.Hay Barn------------This barn would be over 3,700 sq ft set over two floors, on the ground floor there would be a large kitchen with centre island, dining room, lounge, sitting room and an office area.Upstairs there would be four double bedrooms, an en-suite shower room and a family bathroom.Both barns would have large gardens and ample parking.Holiday CottageTo the front of the house is The Cartshed a two bedroom holiday let that is currently used as a holiday let to provide additional income.This has been modernised over the last few years and now offers an open plan kitchen and living room, two bedrooms and a shower room. There are full height double glazed window and underfloor heating throughout.GardensThe gardens extend to the north/north-east side of the property and there is an enclosed paddock of 1 acre and a further area with an allsortment of mature trees and shrubs.In the middle of the main farmhouse and barns is a private garden complete with a pond, steps up to the farmhouse and a lawned area of grass that leads to the empty barn buildings.General InformationHerefordshire County CouncilCouncil Tax Band FOil Fired Central Heating, Electric and WaterProperty is FreeholdBook your viewing 24/7 at Viewing is essential to appreciate everything this fantastic property has to offer and arranging your viewing is simple.You can click on the link within the brochure or download our App and search for the property using the postcode HR2 6PH or give us a call on However, If you can't find a suitable date/time via our system, please contact our Local Property Partner who will try to arrange an alternative appointment.Chris FlemingMobile: Email: Property Ownership InformationTenureFreeholdCouncil Tax BandFDisclaimer For Virtual ViewingsSome or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. complete_description: Brief RésuméA comfortable, well-presented one bedroomed apartment in a popular riverside development. Easy access to lower ground floor. Lovely outlook over the River Greta and Fitz Park, conveniently close to Keswick town centre. For residents over 55 years of age. Must be viewed.DescriptionRiverside Lodge is a purpose-built development of nineteen apartments, constructed in 1989 and professionally managed by Anchor Hanover. Residents must be over 55 years of age and Hanover’s website indicates that cats and dogs are generally accepted. Services include visiting management staff, a community alarm system, and a lift to service all floors, although this apartment is conveniently located on the lower ground floor level. Riverside Lodge is ideally located close to the town centre and within easy level walking distance of most local amenities, as well as being directly opposite the delightful open spaces within Fitz Park which also offers recreational facilities such as tennis, bowls, croquet, and cafe. Riverside Lodge, as the name suggests, is situated directly on the bank of the River Greta, which provides an inspirational outlook over the river to Fitz Park and, with seasonal changes, mountain views beyond.This well-presented apartment comprises reception hall, double bedroom with mirror-fronted wardrobes, living room overlooking the river, and well-appointed breakfast kitchen also overlooking the river, plus luxury modern shower room and a walk-in airing cupboard housing the hot-water tank. The apartment is double glazed, has electric night storage heaters, and emergency 24-hour call line facility. This apartment enjoys easy access from Station Road to lower ground floor level, where there is also an adjacent car park for use by the residents.Accommodation:HallEntrance door. Storage heater. Access to Living Room, Bedroom, Shower Room and large walk-in cupboard.Living RoomDouble glazed window to the rear overlooking the river and Fitz Park. Storage heater. Door to:Breakfast KitchenSealed unit double glazed window to the rear overlooking the river and Fitz Park. Base units comprising double and single cupboards, and drawer pack. Two double wall units. Tall cupboard. Work top. Stainless steel sink with mixer tap. Space for fridge/freezer. Plumbing for washing machine. Space for breakfast table.BedroomSealed unit double glazed window to the front. Fitted wardrobes. Storage heater.Shower RoomWindow. Three-piece suite comprising WC, wash basin and double shower cubicle.ServicesMains electricity, water and drainage are connected. Electric water heating supplied by tank in airing cupboard. Space heating is provided by electric storage heaters. The flat is equipped with an emergency 24-hour call line which may be activated from individual rooms. A lift serves each floor of the building, although this is not required for access to this apartment, and an integrated fire alarm system is installed.Agent’s NoteAppliances included, mobile phone and broadband results not tested by Edwin Thompson Property Services Limited.Qualifications for residency are that residents must be over the age of 55.Council TaxThe Allerdale Borough Council website identifies the property as being within Band ‘’C’, and the total Council Tax payable for the year 2022/23 as being £1,902.98.Tenure and Service ChargeWe are informed that the apartment is held on a 99 year Lease from 2010. A Ground Rent is payable, currently £160 per annum, and a Service Charge of approximately £163 per month for the year 2023 is payable to cover the cost of common services, including maintenance and buildings insurance.OffersAll offers should be made to the Agents, Edwin Thompson Property Services Limited.ViewingStrictly by appointment through the Agents, Edwin Thompson Property Services Limited.Ref: K3180002

name: Land for sale
description: Land for sale in Glendaruel, Colintraive PA22, selling for £150,000 from Scottish Property Centre. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Glendaruel, Colintraive PA22.
complete_description: A residential development site with full planning consent for 3 properties, septic tank installation, associated ground works and landscaping to provide vehicle access and car parking, extending to 1.64 acres (0.66 Hectares) in an area of outstanding beauty. The current planning permission covers 1/3 of the area listed for sale however, the whole site is included in the sale.See Argyll & Bute planning applications - Planning Permission 17/02992/pp. Approved on 06 Apr 2021.The postcode for Clachan of Glendaruel is PA22 3AA and is located 16 miles west of Dunoon the principal town of Argyll and 14 miles south of Strachur on the A886.The Development Site is located within an area designated as one of Natural Beauty. Local amenities in the Clachan includeKilmodan ChurchKilmodan Primary SchoolGlendaruel Community Village HallA local bus service to and from DunoonAn information pack is available from our Dunoon Office.The Cowal Peninsula popularly referred to as Scotlands Secret Coastline and The Gateway to the Western Highlands, provides a whole host of activities - all within easy access from Glendaruel, Cycling, walking and driving for sight-seeing are well catered for. Watersports are plentiful and near, fishing (sea, loch, and river) and stalking and shooting can all be arranged. Half a dozen golf courses are situated within 40 minutes. There are two sailing schools and two fantastic outdoor adventure centres within 35 minutes.Although just an hour and a half from Glasgow, Glendaruel sits in some of the loveliest scenery in Scotland. The nearby Kyles of Bute are renowned by both walkers and sailors alike as being among the most stunning sections of coast in Scotland. Whatever the weather in Argyll - and it does enjoy a remarkably mild micro-climate - this is great country for sightseeing, with every corner revealing a new variation on the theme of mountain, loch, valley, sky, woodland, sea, rock, beach.The Cowal Peninsula is a fabulous base for an active holiday with marvellous wildlife, numerous gardens and other tourist attractions to visit, and all sporting activities catered for. The land sits about 2 miles from Loch Riddon, where mooring facilities can be organised. The Island of Bute itself is as little as 20 minutes away - accessed via a ferry from the neighbouring village of Colintraive - and was a "must visit" destination long before Stella McCartney got married there or former racing driver Johnnie Dumfries moved into Mount Stuart House as the new Marquis of Bute. Lnverary with its famous Jail and Castle , seat of Clan Campbell for the last few hundred years, is only 45 minutes away, as is Loch Lomond.Dunoon is another tourist destination in its own right, and just under half an hour away as is the Portavadie ferry terminal which offers hourly service runs across to Tarbert, Kintyre. Portavadie Marina. This fabulous addition to the local area is a half hour drive from Glendaruel. It boasts a Marina, Hotel, Cottages, Spa and much The Cowal Highland Gathering is the biggest, most spectacular annual Highland Games in the world.

name: 4 bed terraced house for sale
description: 4 bed terraced house for sale in Halliford Street, London N1, selling for £1,200,000 from Wallers Estate Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Halliford Street, London N1.
complete_description: For sale by online auction. Starting Bids £1,200,000 Terms and Conditions apply.A superb, rarely available nineteenth century property in this fashionable, sought after area of North London - Halliford Street in Islington - a quiet residential street close to Essex Road and only a fifteen minute walk from two underground stations. This three storey home has been in the same family (and been loved by the same family) for generations, tracing back over a century - through the Depression, the Blitz, the Swinging Sixties... Imagine the stories this property can tell, about the London it has inhabited, and about the city that has developed around it. The property is now being sold at auction, representing an amazing opportunity for owner-occupier buyers to claim a piece of history to make their own in this desirable part of town - or, alternatively, it offers scope to split and develop into flats... Subject to relevant permissions, of course - but hardly something that has not been done over and over again in this area. A fantastic find, and well worth a visit to view for yourselves...The Accommodation:Steps lead up to the handsome front door, which opens into a welcoming entrance hallway with stairs leading up to the top floor, as well as down to the basement. The main living space is situated to the right of the hallway - a high-ceilinged front room with sash window, feature fireplace and wooden floor, and opening through to the fitted Kitchen which offers a range of fitted units and worktop including island unit.There is a half landing on the stairway down, from which there is a WC and wash basin, as well as door out to steps that lead down to the rear garden.In the Basement Level there are two Double Bedrooms, both of which benefit from built in wardrobes, and one of which features an open en-suite into the Bedroom, with shower cubicle, wc and basin. There is an external door to the rear garden - and indeed, this room could therefore be repurposed to provide a fantastic Day Room accessing the garden, instead of Bedroom, if preferred. The front basement bedroom benefits from further built in storage as well as the fitted wardrobes; a long cupboard - over 5 metres long - provides really useful storage but also has door to the front garden and could therefore provide access from street to a basement flat, for example, if separate accommodation were on the agenda. Also in the basement level, there is a family Bathroom, with bath and shower over, wc and wash basin.Elsewhere in the property, the top floor offers two further Double Bedrooms - the largest of which, spanning around 5.3 metres, the width of the house, and featuring two sash windows and fireplace, is currently being used as a main Living Room. The last bedroom, being another double, features built in wardrobe and has the benefit of an en-suite Sower Room, with shower cubicle, wc and wash basin.The property benefits from front garden, but in particular boasts a lovely, sunny south facing rear garden, with patio area, planted beds and borders and garden shed, and is enclosed by fencing.Gas Central Heating to radiators (wet system).EPC Rating: Tbc - commissioned 10/02/2023Council Tax: FFreeholdAuctioneers Additional Comments: Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'. Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent. The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.Auctioneers Additional Comments: Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer. A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase. In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.Auctioneers Additional Comments: In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon exchange of contracts the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit of 5% of the purchase price of the property. The deposit will be a contribution to the purchase price. A non-refundable reservation fee of 4.5% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of 6,000 inc VAT) is also required to be paid upon agreement of sale. The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. Both the Marketing Agent and The Auctioneer may believe necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or indeed obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

This is arguably one of the best positioned plots on the park and is just two years old. There is a garden area at the rear and it backs onto a private house, making it even more appealing and secluded.An abi ambleside premier with an 18 year lease remaining. This home has two bedrooms, sleeps six and is 40ft long and 14ft wide.Enter through the front door to a large entrance hall which leads to the two bedrooms, family bathroom and kitchen/lounge/diner.The kitchen/diner comes fully fitted throughout with a washing machine, dishwasher, oven, grill, hob, full sized fridge /freezer and microwave.The lounge has an electric Dimplex fire, (brand new) and two large double sofas, one of which is a sofa bed (brand new and unused).There is also a large pouffe, used for storage of blankets etc.The master bedroom is L shaped and has an ensuite bathroom, with a king sized, ottoman storage bed, fully furnished with wardrobes, a dressing table, drawers, bedside tables and an aerial point for a wall mounted TV.The second bedroom has twin beds and is also fully furnished with a wardrobe, bedside table, dressing table and an aerial point for a wall mounted TV.The family bathroom is accessible from the entrance hall.The windows have wooden blinds in the kitchen and ensuite and voiles throughout the rest of the property.This home has been very tastefully designed by the current owners.The curtains throughout compliment the rest of the furniture. The family bathroom has a skylight window.The carpets are a neutral colour.Full gas central heating.A viewing is a must to truly appreciate the outstanding condition and fantastic area this home has to offer.As you arrive, there are two car parking spaces to the front, a footpath which also goes along to the rear, a very well-kept garden area with sleepers, pebbles and plants. Although the decking area has full furnishing, there is still a large amount of space for sun loungers, to laze in the sun. The decking area is south and west facing, enabling you to enjoy the sun from rise to set.

name: 2 bed houseboat for sale
complete_address: Vicarage Lane, Port Werburgh, Hoo, Rochester ME3
description: 2 bed houseboat for sale in Vicarage Lane, Port Werburgh, Hoo, Rochester ME3, selling for £135,000 from Premier Houseboats. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Vicarage Lane, Port Werburgh, Hoo, Rochester ME3.
complete_description: Premier Houseboats are pleased to present Tantalus, a characterful conversion of an ex coal barge, that has been fitted to create a good sized family home with both a traditional and contemporary feel. Tantalus has been converted to create good living space internally and also has two good sized outside areas.Tantalus has had great thought put into her conversion, and has an incredible amount of storage throughout. Entering through the front door there is an office area immediately to your left, that enables you to look down over the main living area. A small set of steps lead down to the main living area, which is a superb size with a large settee and a multi fuel stove, together with plenty of light, and even a giant clock on the ceiling. A step leads up to a sectioned off dining area. Along the corridor is a family bathroom with new toilet, hand basin, double shower cubicle and a small room with radiator for drying clothes. Next is the first bedroom, currently with two built in beds but would easily be a comfortable double.Next along is the kitchen, with plenty of storage and work surface, built in double oven, gas hob and extractor, fridge freezer, washing machine and a breakfast bar.Along from this is the main bedroom, with built in double bed with storage below, and built in wardrobes. A door leads to outside where there is a small deck area, with steps leading to a larger decked terrace on the roof of the boat, offering commanding views and furnished with table and chairs.There is excellent headroom throughout the boat, which also has solid wood flooring, and all windows are double glazed units. There is also full gas central heating run from a gas combi boiler in the kitchen. The swim ends either end of the boat provide even more storage if required. The roof has a slight slope allowing any rain water to run easily off the boat and into the river.Tantalus is ready to move into and is a lovely family home, with superb room both internally and externally, and a good balance of classic and contemporary fittings. The houseboat is freehold and the residential mooring is leasehold.Vessel name: TantalusCondition: GoodConstructed: 1950Refitted: 2018Berths: 4Cabins: 2Heads: 1Length over all: 80'Beam: 15'Maximum draft: 3'Hull material: SteelHull type: FlatDisclaimerPremier Houseboats offers the details of this advert in good faith as it was presented by the seller or his representative but cannot guarantee or warrant the accuracy of this information nor warrant the condition of the described item within this advert. The Item described within this advert is offered subject to prior sale, price change, or withdrawal without notice.

name: 6 bed detached house for sale
description: 6 bed detached house for sale in Allison Road, London N8, selling for £1,275,000 from Winkworth - Harringay. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Allison Road, London N8.
complete_description: Settled at the top of a picturesque Victorian-lined street on the enviable Harringay Ladder, this beautifully renovated and extended six bedroom house with landscaped south-facing garden combines tasteful modern interior design with traditional period detailing creating a lovely open and sociable family home.Occasionally will you find a family house of this quality, including a stunning ground floor kitchen extension, basement and an ambitious roof extension providing two additional rooms, a terrace and a bathroom, and arranged over three-levels and measuring an impressive 2,112 Sq.ft / 196.25 Sq.m of usable floor space.Behind the attractive facade you are greeted by an original tiled entrance hall. The ground floor is occupied by the living/entertaining space, with unusually wide double open plan reception rooms. Natural light pours in through the large bay windows at the front and in to the opening to the rear. Waxed Victorian pine floorboards complete the look with beautiful bespoke fitted shelves and ceiling mouldings above.At the rear you are embraced with a breath-taking fully extended open-plan kitchen and dining/family room with crisp white bespoke kitchen with integrated appliances. A focal point being the oversize roof lights and ceiling height bi-fold doors providing natural light opening onto a peaceful south-facing rear garden with dark grey stone patio ideal for BBQ’s overlooking the manicured lawn and borders.On the first floor there are three bedrooms and an office, the largest of which occupies the entire width of the front with large bay and a lovely family bathroom. The loft space has been converted to provide two more rooms, one of which encompasses the whole loft space with en-suite bathroom, and a second room with a stunning terrace with far reaching views out over the Shard.This is a great area, becoming more sought-after by the day, with great transport links at Manor House, Finsbury Park (Piccadilly and Victoria Line) and Harringay Over Land Station and shopping and entertainment at your door step. The green spaces of Finsbury Park and Woodberry Wetlands are walkable, too.The highly acclaimed North Harringay and South Harringay Primary schools are a stone’s throw away and you're never more than 20 minutes from a farmers market and Crouch End Broadway with its independent stores including cinema, coffee shops and vast array of restaurants.You Can Follow us on Instagram - @winkworthharringayPlease contact the Sales department at Winkworth Harringay office to arrange an appointment to view Your local independently owned property agency with a network of 58 London offices.Est 1835

This property has so much to offer including a huge seller room with access from the rear as well as a staircase down from inside the property. This consists of lights, electric and sockets. There is also a walk in shower cubicle with black finishes and rain fall shower. There is a modern vanity sink unit with LED mirror above with on-trend painted panelled walls (can you tell how much I love this bathroom!). There is also a spacious landing area leading to three good sized bedrooms, two with stunning views over the valley. The property is available as a freehold and with no upper chain. name: 5 bed end terrace house for sale
description: 5 bed end terrace house for sale in Chisenhale Road, London E3, selling for £1,100,000 from Look Property Services. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Chisenhale Road, London E3.
complete_description: A unique and spacious Victorian period house, on the corner of Chisenhale Road and Kenilworth Road, a quiet, sought-after, tree lined street in the Driffield Road Conservation Area. This property was last sold in 1992, it has been well maintained but would benefit from some modernization. The sash windows have been replaced with wooden double-glazed sliding box sash windows with the exception of one window.Being the corner house the design of the interior is a surprisingly generous 1674 square feet / 155.6 square metres across three floors comprising a through lounge, a kitchen living dining room, five bedrooms, a bathroom, a shower room and a lovely courtyard garden with lots of different plants and small trees. The house benefits from lots of original character, features, and storage.AccommodationThe front door is on the side of the house on Kenilworth Road, with five steps up into a recessed porch. On the raised ground floor, there is an entrance hallway, an attractive through lounge that benefits from the extra width of the building at the front, large sash windows, and a marble fireplace, there is also a bedroom located at the rear.Upstairs there is a sizeable landing with a sash window and access to the loft which in turn has a hatch providing access to the main roof for maintenance. The master bedroom is at the front of the house, another double bedroom facing the garden, the family bathroom, and another bedroom at the rear, accessed via some steps down from the landing.The staircase from the entrance hallway leads down to the lower ground floor into a small hall, with fitted storage cupboards on two walls, a utility storeroom that currently houses a fridge freezer, as well as the utility meters and the consumer unit. The through room has a ceramic tiled floor and houses the kitchen living dining room, this appealing room has half-glazed double doors to the front providing access to the front courtyard with paving, planting, and railings above. The two fire breasts and the wall in between are exposed bricks. The fitted kitchen is located at the front making the most of the additional width, the boiler is in the opposite front corner. The living area at the rear has fully glazed double doors that open onto the rear garden, there is a log burner, our vendor informs us that the lining had been damaged and would require replacing to enable the burner to be used. From the hallway there is access to the fifth bedroom/garden room on this level with an original sash window and a fully glazed door onto the rear garden, there is an ensuite shower/wet room.The rear garden is small for the area at approximately 4.4 X 4.1 metres, it is South facing has paving and abundant planting with a Mediterranean feel, including Olive, Fig, Philadelphus, Jasmine, Honeysuckle, Ornamental Hop, Pyracanthas, Eunomous, clematis and roses.History and PotentialThe vendors have replaced the windows and doors with the exception of one window. In August 1992, tanking works were carried out to the flank wall in the basement. Recently some areas of brickwork on the front have been repointed.Subject to planning permission that observes the conservation area guidelines it could be possible to obtain permission for a mansard roof extension adding another floor of accommodation.Tenure: FreeholdThe Roman Road and Bow NeighbourhoodThis sought after neighbourhood is a thriving, highly desirable and lively place to live, with good schools, beautiful green spaces and a well-known food and drink culture. The excellent transport links provide easy access to the City, Canary Wharf and beyond, making it an ideal location for professionals and families alike.Chisenhale Road and the other Victorian streets of the Driffield Road Conservation area are not only an architectural delight, but they are very friendly and have a strong community feel, and the house is in the catchment area of the popular Chisenhale Primary School.Mile End park and Hertford Union Canal are 2 minutes’ walk away from your door step.Despite the quietness of the immediate locality, the Roman Road and Bow in general, provide bustle and life with a plethora of independent cafes, bars and restaurants to choose from and a variety of convenience stores are at hand. From independent boutiques to well-known high street brands, there is something to suit all tastes and budgets.The famous Roman Road Market offers an eclectic mix of vintage clothing, fresh produce, and artisanal goods, and there is a Sunday food market in the park, with Broadway and the Columbia Road Flower Markets, a 20-minute stroll along the picturesque Regents Canal.Mile End tube station is just a short walk away from where the Central, District, and Hammersmith and City lines can be accessed, providing easy access to all parts of the city. Express coaches to Stanstead Airport leave from Mile End, and from Whitechapel, two stops west of Mile End, Heathrow Airport can be reached in 35 minutes via the Elizabeth Line. There are also excellent bus links, including the number 8, D6,277,425 and 339 buses, making it easy to get around the local area in all directions and beyond.Victoria Park, which is a 213-acre park that was opened in 1845 and is one of the oldest public parks in London. It features a large lake, numerous walking and cycling paths, playgrounds, cafes, and sports facilities. The park also hosts various events throughout the year, including music festivals, food markets, and sporting events. It is considered one of the most popular and well-loved parks in London, providing a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. The Olympic Park and London Stadium are a 20-minute walk away, and the Regents Canal, that flows beside Victoria Park, connects Limehouse Basin and the Thames to the South and Islington to the north.It is no wonder that properties are in high demand in this special area, with its unique blend of old-world charm, modern-day convenience and beautiful green spaces.

complete_description: This property is a spacious 3 bedroom mid-terrace town house located in Pollokshaws - a prime rental and family location in Glasgow that has easy direct transport links into the city centre. It has long term tenants currently situated and generates good rental returns.This well-kept home is neutrally decorated throughout and features gas-fired central heating, 3 bedrooms, a three piece bathroom, a spacious lounge and kitchen.Investment DetailsThe property currently produces an annual gross income of £7,560 which could be increased by the new owner to a market rate of £10,800 with long term tenants currently situated. Considering the purchase price, this will make for a worthwhile addition to an investors property portfolio.For greater detail on this property's investment potential, please see the Let Property Pack linked below.If you are interested in viewing the Home Report, please call us.TenantThe current tenant has lived in the property for several years and has consistently paid their rent for the duration of their stay. They do not have any intentions to move out so hope to remain in the property.LocationThe property is located within an ideal family area in Pollokshaws that has several schools within walking distance of it. It is also in close proximity to the Auldhouse Retail Park so the tenants have easy access to several valuable amenities like supermarkets, retail and department stores, cafes and restaurants, leisure facilities and other, useful local businesses.The Pollokshaws West train station is also accessible here and as the A77 Main Road runs through the area, travel to surrounding areas like Giffnock, Queens Park and, most importantly, Glasgow City Centre, is direct and convenient.LoungeThe lounge is a good size and makes for an ample living area with plenty of room for furniture.KitchenThe kitchen is a reasonable size and has been kept in good condition by the tenants.BathroomThe bathroom consists of a wash basin, W.C. And bath tub with an overhead shower attachment.BedroomsAll bedrooms are a good size with enough room for, king sized beds, bedroom furniture and storage cabinets.ExteriorThere are a front and rear garden grounds found external to the property.Let Property Sales are committed to facilitating a smooth transaction process and to allow for maximum commitment to the sale from both parties, a fully refundable buyers premium may apply to secure a property. This amount is not an additional cost and is refunded in the event of non completion.

name: 1 bed property for sale
complete_address: Dibles Park, Dibles Road, Warsash, Southampton SO31
description: 1 bed property for sale in Dibles Park, Dibles Road, Warsash, Southampton SO31, selling for £140,000 from Robinson Reade Ltd. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Dibles Park, Dibles Road, Warsash, Southampton SO31.
complete_description: Dibles Park is in an enviable location close to Warsash Common for those who enjoy their walks and just ¾ mile stroll to Warsash Village centre with a good local pub, The Jolly Farmer, nearer by. Driving into the park you will notice how tidy and well maintained it is, there is an on-site manager to run things including the touring pitches which help to subsidise the running costs of the park.This light and airy mobile home has a pitched roof, enclosed brick skirt contributing to its insulation and brick steps leading to the entrance door adding to its curb appeal. There is a driveway for two cars alongside the property. A doorway leads into the open sitting room/kitchen with large window at the front and door and window to the side allowing you to open everything up in the summer or just enjoy seeing the coming & goings in the winter.The kitchen has built in slimline dishwasher, fridge/freezer and breakfast bench to enjoy you morning coffee. A separate utility room with plumbing for washing machine and space for separate fridge and storage cupboards housing the gas combination boiler servicing the hot water and heating. Back off the hallway are the bedroom and shower rooms. This double bedroom has fitted mirrored wardrobes. The shower room has a large walk-in shower.The gardens are all open plan, however, enjoying a side plot there is a private paved area for sitting out, there is also a good size shed/store which has power connected. Dibles Park is managed by a residents’ owned management company and the land is leased from Fareham Borough Council, there is an individual mains gas supply with metered electric & water supplied via the site, pets are not allowed. The property benefits from UPVC double glazing throughout and a gas central system via a combi-boiler making it a very cosy feeling home. There is no forward chain and with no solicitors required to complete the transaction if you have the cash you could be moved in no time at all.Other InformationWe have been advised that the Park's 50 year lease from Fareham Borough Council commenced in 2013. There is a site charge of £123.00 payable monthly to Dibles Park Company Ltd, this includes the upkeep of the park and ground rent payable to Fareham Borough Council. Pets are not allowed. There is no stamp duty payable on the purchase of a mobile home. There is an event fee of 10% of the sale price upon disposal of the property payable to Dibles Park Company Ltd. There is mains gas - Water & electric are metered and supplied via the site.
features:
• Leasehold

  • The park is open plan but there is a private patio to the side for you to sit out and enjoy the sun

description: 2 bed flat for sale in 14A Moss Street, Paisley PA1, selling for £97,500 from Purplebricks, Head Office. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in 14A Moss Street, Paisley PA1.
complete_description: This has to be one of the trendiest flats to reach the market in Paisley town centre for some time and as such is well worth an early viewing. This converted first floor apartment is situated within a terraced block that houses just four flats in total. There is a secure entry system into the communal area and stairwell that leads to the first floor landing, there is a solid timber door accessing a welcoming and freshly decorated entrance hall with a store cupboard off, there is a glass and steel bannister leading up three steps in to the comfortable and high specification finished living / dining room / modern kitchen. The kitchen itself has a range of floor and wall mounted units as well a ceramic hob and under oven, stainless steel sink and splashback above the worktops. There are two bedrooms one having a fitted cupboard as well as a good quality family bathroom with a shower above.There is gas central heating and full double glazing, as well as a communal landing store area.The Oakshaw area of Paisley lies behind the High Street and is one of the oldest inhabited areas of Paisley. It is reputed to have had a Roman Fort, or at the very least a Roman presence, although current thinking now suggests that the site may date as far back as the Iron Age. The area houses many Churches, some still used for worship, many converted to apartments, and some converted for community projects such as The Wynd Centre and pace, as well as other interesting buildings to include the Coats Observatory, Hutcheson School, Peter Brough Home for Nurses and of course the John Neilson Institution.There are a variety of social recreational and transport amenities on your doorstep from this location as well as Paisley Gilmour street station which is 2 minutes away with links to Glasgow and the coastal areas.Entrance HallStorage CupboardOpen Plan Living22'5 x 19'9Bedroom One12'1 x 12'0Bedroom Two10'1 x 8'6Storage RoomBathroom7'3 x 6'2Property Ownership InformationTenureFreeholdCouncil Tax BandCDisclaimer For Virtual ViewingsSome or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. complete_description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire this spacious Grade II listed property offering huge potential to a purchaser which is currently in office useDescriptionBelmont is a handsome Grade II listed townhouse bursting with a wealth of period charm and features and extending to over 3400sq ft of impressive potential accommodation. The current use is office (Class E) but this property has the benefit of change of use to a residential dwelling (Class C) Please search Bath and North East Somerset Council Planning Portal for application 22/04393/ful.The property is entered at ground floor level into a wonderful entrance hall with beautiful staircase rising to the upper floors. There are two impressive reception rooms on each of the ground and first floor both with beautiful sash windows and fireplaces.On the second and third floors are further rooms which would make ideal bedroom(Subject to the necessary consents being obtained) as well as a kitchen and two WC’s.To the front there is a view down Alfred Street to the Circus and to the rear you get a panoramic view to the East of Bath.On the lower floor to the rear is a spacious room with the original fireplaces where the kitchen once would have been and access to the garden. There is a further room to the front, two WC’s and access to a vault.LocationBelmont is a handsome Grade II listed terrace in an elevated position on the high pavement of lower Lansdown. The property is situated less than 0.5 miles from the city centre and is close to a number of Bath’s landmark locations including The Assembly Rooms, The Circus and Royal Crescent.Bath provides excellent cultural and leisure amenities including many fine restaurants and specialist shops, museums, art galleries and theatres. Bath has excellent communications and is approximately 10 miles from Junction 18 of the M4. There are also high speed train services from Bath Spa Railway Station to London Paddington (from 75 minutes).

complete_description: Located within one of Horsell’s most popular cul-de-sac locations, Copper Tree is a delightful four bedroom detached family home that boasts an impressive amount of accommodation in excess of 2000 sq ft and is situated on a generous plot with extensive mature gardens.The property is well presented throughout, with bright and airy accommodation that includes a living room with double doors to the dining room. Parquet flooring runs throughout this warm and homely area. The large rectangular shaped kitchen opens to the dining area and is fitted with modern high gloss units. Accompanied by a range of integrated appliances, a central island also makes this a highly sociable area. In addition, there is a handy utility room and a conservatory that offers beautiful views of the gardens.Head to the first floor, and you will find four well proportioned bedrooms. Bedroom one is particularly impressive and features ample built-in storage and a modern en-suite bath/shower room with a large walk in shower. The family shower room has a large walk in shower.The rear garden is a wonderful feature of the property. Mainly laid to lawn with mature trees and planting, the garden stretches in excess of 100 ft and enjoys a backdrop of near complete privacy. There are multiple patio seating areas to enjoy throughout the day.Double parking space on the driveway is located at the front of the property alongside access to the garage.Horsell Village remains popular with buyers looking in the wider Woking area. It offers excellent access to transport links such as the M25 & M3 as well as the fast train link into London Waterloo via the much improved Woking town centre. Within the village, there is a popular range of independent shops and amenities, whilst the busier Woking offers a full range of shopping and leisure facilities.
