description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Gordon Road, Hiltingbury, Chandlers Ford, Hampshire SO53, selling for £1,150,000 from Marco Harris. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Gordon Road, Hiltingbury, Chandlers Ford, Hampshire SO53.
complete_description: Welcome To Gordon Road! Watch the Video Tour!Hiltingbury Infant, Junior and Thornden Secondary School CatchmentThis is an extended, four-bedroom, detached house with both a large driveway and double garage, all sat on a plot exceeding a third of an acre. Well-placed for journeys in and out the area, swift routes onto the M27 & M3 make this area popular amongst commuters. A number of mainline stations sit nearby, providing easy access to Bournemouth, Salisbury and London Waterloo. Further transport links are abundant, with buses available from a number of stops to take you to Eastleigh, Southampton and Winchester. The area is highly requested amongst growing families due to the popular selection of schools nearby. You will be hard pressed to find a better location that ticks this many boxes.A sizeable, gravel driveway leads you towards the front door sheltered by a storm-porch. The entrance hall welcomes you in to the home, with the living room to your left and to your right, a cloakroom, the snug and doorway to the extended rear of the property, comprising utility room, kitchen/dining room and secondary area currently also used for dining. The accommodation to the ground floor is very much versatile and can be adapted to your individual needs quite easily.The perfect entertaining space, the kitchen/Dining Room area looks out in to the rear garden, accessed via folding doors. On a sunny day, the over-head, lantern skylights flood the room with copious amounts of natural light, enhanced throughout the downstairs thanks to the light colour-scheme. The kitchen itself is fitted with all the usual integrated appliances you'd expect, complimented by copious cupboard-space and a large island.Upstairs, the enormous landing leads to the family bathroom and four bedrooms, with the primary benefiting from a walk-in-wardrobe which leads on to a four-piece en-suite. The other bedrooms to the rear of the property are both well proportioned doubles, with a single to the front. There's also a four-piece family bathroom with a large double shower cubicle.The garage is big enough to fit two vehicles and a bit more, with storage above.The outside areas are thoughtfully landscaped, with decking, a patio, and a large lawn area to the rear. The front features a wide range of mature shrubs and bushes, as well as a lawned area and flowers. These gardens really shine in the spring and summer!I anticipate huge demand for this property, so please be quick to book your viewing. Due to this, there will only be limited viewing slots available. If you are struggling to get through, visit us on Instagram. You will be able to contact me via DMs or WhatsApp, which is available via the links in the bio's on these pages - @marcoharrisuk & @danabbottrealestateUseful Additional InformationTenure: FreeholdHeating: GasLocal Council: Eastleigh BoroughCouncil Tax Band: FEPC Rating: EVendor Position: Buying OnwardsDisclaimer Property Details: Whilst believed to be accurate all details are set out as a general outline only for guidance and do not constitute any part of an offer or contract. Intending purchasers should not rely on them as statements or representation of fact but must satisfy themselves by inspection or otherwise as to their accuracy. We have not carried out a detailed survey nor tested the services, appliances, and specific fittings. Room sizes should not be relied upon for carpets and furnishings. The measurements given are approximate.

description: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale in Barley Road, Kirby Cross, Frinton-On-Sea CO13, selling for £157,500 from Urban Moves. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Barley Road, Kirby Cross, Frinton-On-Sea CO13.
complete_description: Shared ownership (Advertised price represents 50% share. Full market value £315,000). A great chance to buy a spacious shared-ownership family home. The recently-built, semi-detached property has a conventional, modern layout: A ground-floor cloakroom, a kitchen / dining room and a rear reception room which opens onto a garden with patio and generously-sized lawn. Upstairs is a main bedroom with en-suite shower room plus comfortable second double bedroom, a smaller third bedroom and a naturally-lit bathroom. The energy-efficiency rating is very good, thanks to well insulated walls, roof and floor, high performance glazing and gas central heating. A driveway provides off-street parking space for two cars or, alternatively, Kirby Cross Station, for rail services between Colchester and the coast, is only a short walk away.Interested parties are required to complete the shared ownership common application form[](Please note the minimum income and deposit requirements for eligibility. You do not need to request a viewing separately once you have completed the application form.)Housing Association: heylo.Tenure: Leasehold (125 years from 2020).Minimum Share: 50% (£157,500).Shared Ownership Rent: £381.68 per month (subject to annual review, this figure is for the year April 2023 to March 2024).Insurance + Management Fee + Expected Estate Charge: £63.88 per month (subject to annual review).Guideline Minimum Income: Dual - £41,700 Single - £48,000 (based on minimum share and 10% deposit).Council Tax: Band C, Tendring District Council. Priority is given to applicants living and/or working in this local authority.This property is offered for sale in the condition seen. The housing association does not warrant to carry out any remedial or redecoration work of a cosmetic nature unless specifically advised in writing. As a general rule, fitted domestic appliances are included in the sale; non-fitted appliances are not. If you require confirmation, you must request this in writing from Urban Moves. The information in this document supersedes any information given verbally either in person or by telephone.What is shared ownership ?Shared Ownership is a housing scheme designed to help homebuyers who are unable to afford the cost of buying a property outright on the open market. Properties may be sold off-plan or new build direct from housing associations, or pre-owned from existing shared owners. The rules and terms of the scheme are set by the Greater London Authority (gla) in London and Homes England outside of London.Is shared ownership for you ?The gla and Homes England set the eligibility criteria for Shared Ownership, but broadly speaking you must:1. Not own another property in the UK or any other country.2. Have a household income that falls below £90,000 (£80,000 threshold outside the M25). Every property will have a minimum income level too, determined by its’ value, rent and service charge costs. In most cases you will need to meet or exceed the given minimum income.3. Have access to a minimum deposit of 10% of the share being purchased (a minimum deposit of 5% of the share being purchased may be acceptable depending on individual financial status).4. Be in full time permanent employment.5. Be a British, EU or eea Citizen or have indefinite leave to remain in the UK.6. Have a good credit history.Ground FloorEntrance HallwayCloakroomKitchen / Dining Room15' 9" x 9' 2" (4.80m x 2.79m)Reception Room16' 3" max. X 10' 7" min. (4.95m x 3.23m)First FloorBedroom 114' 4" max. X 9' 1" max. (4.37m x 2.77m)En-Suite Shower RoomBedroom 211' 7" max. X 9' 1" max. (3.53m x 2.77m)Bedroom 310' 4" max. X 6' 11" max. The guide price or range of guide prices is given to assist consumers in deciding whether or not to pursue a purchase. It is usual, but not always the case, that a provisional reserve range is agreed between the seller and the auctioneer at the start of marketing. As the reserve is not fixed at this stage and can be adjusted by the seller at any time up to the day of the auction in the light of interest shown during the marketing period, a guide price is issued. This guide price can be shown in the form of a minimum and maximum price range within which an acceptable sale price (reserve) would fall, or as a single price figure within 10% of which the minimum acceptable price (reserve) would fall. A guide price is different to a reserve price (see separate definition). Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.Reserve PriceThe seller’s minimum acceptable price at auction and the figure below which the auctioneer cannot sell. The reserve price is not disclosed and remains confidential between the seller and the auctioneer.Both the guide price and the reserve price can be subject to change up to and including the day of the auction.

complete_description: An extremely sought-after cul-de-sac location (0.35 miles from Amersham train station and Hervines Park)A modern and contemporary 5 bedroom and 3 bathroom (2 ensuite) detached property, situated 0.15 mile walk from the amenities of Amersham. The current owners have completed a comprehensive schedule of improvements, creating a spacious and easy to maintain home, perfect for busy families and discerning downsizers alike. To the front is a driveway, leading to an integral garage, whilst to the rear is a private 50ft lawned garden complete with large full width patio, ideal for home entertaining. Freehold - epr: D - Council Tax Band: GDirectionsFrom our Amersham office, go up Hill Avenue and continue straight over the two mini-roundabouts into Chesham Road. Turn first left into Hervines Road. Hervines Court is immediately on the right-hand side.LocationSet in the picturesque Chilterns, Amersham is a vibrant town which offers a superb balance between commuter convenience (the Metropolitan and Chiltern lines offering prompt service to Central London are located only approx. 0.35 miles from the property) and easy access to the surrounding countryside. There are two distinct areas: Old Amersham, set in the valley of the River Misbourne, which contains the 13th century parish church of St. Mary's and several old pubs, coaching inns and boutique shops; and Amersham-on-the-Hill, which grew rapidly around the railway station in the early part of the 20th century which now contains the main shopping area with high street brands such as Waitrose, Marks & Spencers and Boots, as well as a variety of eateries and coffee shops.The property benefits from easy access to highly regarded schooling at both primary and senior level including the renowned Dr Challoner’s Grammar Schools (Boys & Girls) and Amersham High. Independent schooling is also well catered for with The Beacon School (Boys) and Heatherton (Girls) locally for Nursery – Year 8; whilst senior schooling can be found at Berkhamsted School (Boys & Girls), Royal Masonic (Girls) & Pipers Corner (Girls) all within 8 miles from Amersham.

name: 4 bed country house for sale
description: 4 bed country house for sale in Upper Wilshaw, Wilshaw, Holmfirth HD9, selling for £1,250,000 from Belong, by James White. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Upper Wilshaw, Wilshaw, Holmfirth HD9.
complete_description: Ash Cottage is an elegant period house, standing in approximately 1.7 acres, within the much sought after hamlet of Wilshaw, above Holmfirth.Sit a while in the gardens and enjoy the sound of your children playing or evening bird song, and admire all that is around you. With a view of a beautiful church spire, the gardens are both extensive and private. Perfect for little ones to roam in safety, and ideal for those with green fingers. There are established lawns with beautiful mature trees, as well as rustic garden areas that offer further potential.There is ample parking, various outbuildings, and small woodland copse's too. Discerning buyers with an additional budget may wish to explore the possibility of extending, or in future years potentially developing the property further, subject to planning permission, but we think it is perfect, just the way it is.Constructed circa 1840 by the Hirst family believed by our clients to have been designed by an Italian architect, he house displays character and charm, and enjoys high ceilings, arched window heads and most of the rooms are double aspect allowing for lots of natural light. The family then went on to build the nearby church at the bottom of the garden in honour of their daughter Mary, and later the Almshouses. Ash cottage is situated in its own private parkland garden on the edge of the Peak District and Pennines.Period fireplaces, deep skirting boards and a lovely hallway add to the stature of the property.There are four bedrooms in total, three being double bedrooms, and one single. In addition, there is a shower room and separate bathroom.The ground floor accommodation is suited to daily life, with a variety of reception rooms allowing for various activities, complemented by the addition of a beautiful sun lounge/garden room looking over the rear patio and beyond.The kitchen has been opened up and has an adjacent morning room, perfect for breakfasting or just daily family interaction. There is a formal dining room and separate drawing room also. One can imagine sitting back and relaxing in front of an open fire, especially on cold winter evenings or Christmas time. Wine and storage cellars provide additional useful space.Approaching Ash Cottage from the driveway one cannot fail to appreciate the beauty of this lovely family home and the setting that it enjoys. It has neighbours, but is private, it is in the countryside, but is so easy to access.Business travellers will appreciate the road links to Manchester, and local buyers will appreciate the extensive amenities on offer across the Holme Valley. There are several local villages with a variety of amenities, independent businesses, places to eat out and socialise, a local golf course within walking distance, public services, bus services, supermarkets and a variety of other activities, including sports and social clubs too. A fabulous location for those who enjoy the outdoors, with cycling, riding and local countryside and scenery all on the doorstep.Buying Ash Cottage is a lifestyle decision, one we think that a discerning buyer will never regret.Viewings are strictly by appointment with James White via our Honley Office. The essentials: The property is Freehold. Mains services are available. Council Tax Band G. The house is in a conservation area with tree protection orders. There is restricted vehicular access to the Alms Houses.

name: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale
description: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale in Ashberry Close, Faversham ME13, selling for £164,000 from Foundation Estate Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Ashberry Close, Faversham ME13.
complete_description: We present a 40% shared ownership on a striking three-bedroom semi-detached property set within an exclusive development moment from Faversham’s bustling market town centre.Perfect for a first-time buyer looking for a modern property with over 900 sq.ft of beautifully appointed accommodation, which includes an open plan living area, off road parking and a recently landscaped west facing garden.The composite front door sits beneath a canopy and is a striking contrast to the tile hung façade. This opens into a wide entrance hall with cloakroom, and under stairs storage.The wood effect flooring runs through a bright and airy open plan family space with French doors to the garden. Slatted blinds have been fitted throughout and add another level of elegance to the property.The kitchen to the front offers an array of floor and wall units set around laminate work tops and integrates several appliances including a Zanussi oven and gas hob along with a fridge freezer.Stairs from the entrance hall rise to the first floor where one will find a galleried landing with linen cupboard which holds a clothes dryer, which could be left with the sale of the property.There is two double bedrooms and a generous single room, perfect for a child or home office. The well-appointed family bathroom has a stylish white suite with rainfall shower over the bath.An extremely energy efficient home with excellent insulation, double glazing throughout, low energy lighting and an economic combination boiler with temperature zone controlled central heating.Outside:The west facing garden is a generous size and has recently been landscaped to offer a large patio area ideal for alfresco dining. An aluminium pergola has been installed directly outside the French doors whilst the rest of the garden is mainly laid to lawn with some raised flower beds at the foot.A storage shed sits discreetly at the side of the property and there is access to the drive via a gated fence.The development is expanding, and planning is pending to build a day nursery, health centre and a cricket pitch. This is a wonderful addition to the town centre and recreation ground which is a short walk away.Agents note:Maintenance and services charges apply of approximately £46 a month in addition to the rental fee of approx. £558. Subject to eligibility for the shared ownership scheme, purchase criteria will apply.Full market share value £410,000 40% share at £164,000situation:The property is conveniently situated in Ashberry Place which enjoys an excellent location surrounded by countryside, yet within easy walking distance of Faversham’s mainline railway station, the recreation grounds, and the thriving medieval town centre.The charming market town of Faversham has a wide range of high street shops and independent retailers which adorn its attractive high street and its bustling market square. The town also offers excellent leisure facilities with an indoor and outdoor swimming pool, a cinema, a large park and recreation ground, a museum and numerous pubs and restaurants.It has a good selection of primary schools and two secondary schools, one of which is the renowned Queen Elizabeth Grammar School. Faversham has a mainline railway station with a regular service to London Victoria, Cannon Street and Charing Cross and a high-speed rail link to London St. Pancras. The nearby M2 motorway gives excellent and fast access to London.The city of Canterbury is approximately 10 miles away this has a vibrant city centre, which has a wide array of High Street brands alongside independent retailers, cafes and international restaurants and offers a selection of sporting, leisure, and recreational amenities, including the Marlowe Theatre.The seaside town of Whitstable, famous for its seafood and annual oyster festival held at the vibrant harbour and picturesque quayside, also has a variety of shops, boutiques and restaurants, a good selection of primary and secondary schools and excellent leisure facilities and is 8 miles away.We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. name: 2 bed end terrace house for sale
complete_address: Dick Quadrant, Cardross, Argyll & Bute G82
description: 2 bed end terrace house for sale in Dick Quadrant, Cardross, Argyll & Bute G82, selling for £144,000 from Clyde Property, Helensburgh. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Dick Quadrant, Cardross, Argyll & Bute G82.
complete_description: Located in the heart of the conservation village of Cardross, Dick Quadrant is a lovely courtyard style, cul-de-sac development made up of terraced houses and flats. The properties overlook central lawned communal grounds and being off the main road, there is plenty of parking for residents adjacent to the house.Number 6 is an end terraced villa, tucked away in the far corner of the development, enjoying beautiful, level rear gardens that feature a timber built summer house/which is perfectly suited for use as a home office. The garden features lawns and lovely block paved patio areas and are completely enclosed by fencing on all sides, making it perfect for pets and children.Internally the house is as impressive, being impeccably presented, with tastefully decorated rooms complimented by a high end specification that includes a refitted kitchen and bathroom and stylish wooden window shutters in the lounge/dining room, and both bedrooms. All of the windows are double glazed and a modern gas fired central heating system provides the heating. On the ground floor, the reception hall has built-in storage and a staircase to the upper floor. Off the hall is the kitchen and a bright and spacious lounge/dining room which has windows at either end and features a period style fire surround with living flame gas fire. The contemporary kitchen features wall and base units and a range of appliances that include a gas hob, electric oven, integrated fridge/freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. A small breakfast bar is a further welcome feature and a door leads out to the gardens.Moving on to the upstairs, the landing has a window to one side and a built-in cupboard and there are two good sized double bedrooms (one to the front and one to the rear).The front bedroom has a deep built-in wardrobe and the back bedroom has a built-in double wardrobe and a single wardrobe. The beautiful bathroom has been refitted with a modern white suite including a p-shaped bath, wc and wash basin. The suite is complimented by attractive tiling and there is a thermostatically controlled shower over the bath. The loft space has been floored and provides further storage space.As mentioned, Cardross has conservation village status and offers a wide selection of fantastic amenities. These include a local primary which is highly regarded in the area, a picturesque golf club, bowling and tennis club, along with a train station linking Cardross to Helensburgh and also to Glasgow and Edinburgh in the other direction. Bus services run through the village from Cardross to Dumbarton, Glasgow and Helensburgh and the larger towns of Helensburgh and Dumbarton both offer more extensive amenities including schooling, shopping, supermarkets, bars and restaurants. Glasgow is within easy commuting distance of Cardross and can be reached by car in around twenty five minutes. The iconic shores of Loch Lomond are also only a short drive away and the area is synonymous with those who enjoy an outdoor lifestyle, with stunning scenery, hill climbing, walks and water sports on the Firth of Clyde. EPC - Band C.

complete_description: Opportunity to acquire this 1 bedroom ground floor flat with no ongoing chain. Considered an Ideal first time purchase or those buyers seeking a bolthole retreat. Open plan accommodation of lounge, kitchen and diner. Balcony terrace with pleasant view.This is an excellent opportunity to acquire a 1 bedroom ground floor self contained flat situated within a convenient central position located within a matter paces to Ilfracombe High Street and is also within a stones throw to the promenade and sea front. The agents consider the property an ideal first time purchase or alternatively will be of interest to those purchasers looking for a lock up and leave bolt hole retreat. The property benefits from a wet electric heating system, furthermore, there is no ongoing chain therefore, the property can be occupied with the minimum of delay.Briefly the internal accommodation comprises entrance door to an inner hall serving all rooms, there is a spacious open plan lounge kitchen diner, which has a comprehensive range of shaker style base and wall units with expanse of working surfaces with inset electric hob and oven below. Bedroom 1 is good size double room with 2 x fitted cupboards, there are patio doors that directly out onto a spacious balcony terrace which enjoys a fine view. The bathroom comprises of a 3 piece white suite to include a bath with shower mixer fed from the mains, WC and wash hand basin.The agents advise an internal viewing to appreciate the deceptive accommodation and the convenient central position the apartment occupies.Communal HallInner Hall (1.37m x 1.09m (4'6 x 3'7))Open Plan Lounge Kitchen Diner (5.44m into bay x 4.52m (17'10 into bay x 14'10))Bedroom 1 (4.37m x 2.62m (14'4 x 8'7 ))Bathroom (3.12m x 1.22m (10'3 x 4'0))Balcony TerraceNo Onward ChainCentral PositionPleasant ViewIlfracombe itself is a good sized Victorian seaside town and caters well for its inhabitants having a bustling High Street lined with, banks and cafes, only a few minutes walk away. There is a wide variety of independent shops, along with a range of supermarkets including Tesco, Lidl and Co-Op. There are three schools within the town to cater for all ages to include an Infant & junior School, and Secondary/Sixth Form School.For entertainment, the award-winning Landmark Theatre is on the Promenade, whilst there is also a 3 screen cinema, a swimming pool and a golf course. The very attractive harbour has a further selection of shops and art galleries, and Damien Hirst's 25m high 'Verity' stands proud on the pier. The South West Coast Path runs through the town and opens up many miles of superb walks along the rugged North Devon coastline with it's spectacular scenery and views over the Bristol Channel.

complete_description: SummaryThe property is in close proximity to all local amenities, with West Derby village just a stones throw away, full of shops, pubs, cafes and salons, as well as having an abundance of great schools in the area and transport links with access to Warrington and Manchester, ideal for the daily commute.DescriptionSet in a popular residential area of West Derby, on a quiet road, is this well presented three bedroom mid terrace property, an ideal home for first time buyers and Investors. The accommodation is bright and spacious throughout. Downstairs the property has a good sized living room, Leading from this is a spacious dining room and fitted kitchen, making this space perfect for entertaining family and friends. To the first floor are two good sized double bedrooms, with plenty of storage and a single bedroom, ideal as a nursery, dressing room or study and there is a family bathroom. Outside is a beautiful rear yard, with a patio area, making a perfect outdoor living space for alfresco summer evenings. To the front of the property is on street parking.Auctioneer's CommentsThis property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. There is a railway station just a 2 minute walk from thepark and an excellent bus service‚ which cuts the hassle of taking your car into a very busy town‚ especially in the spring and summer months. The beach is just over a 20 minute walk away‚ there is a garden centre opposite the park‚ with a restaurant just a 10 minute walk and local pub another 10 minutes further up. Of course‚ you do not have to leave the park for a few drinks‚ as there is a clubhouse that provides some fantastic entertainment‚ along with an amusement area and a chip shop.ConditionsThere are only two main conditions of becoming an owner at Ridgeway Park Resort. The first is that you must still have a main residence elsewhere and secondly; you may not let your holiday home out to the general public. It is strictly for family and friends only. This will make the park quite unique as it will create a little community feel to it.

name: 6 bed property for sale
description: 6 bed property for sale in Colchester Road, Earls Colne CO6, selling for £1,250,000 from Heritage. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Colchester Road, Earls Colne CO6.
complete_description: Chalkney Mill, a former working water mill on the banks of the River Colne and converted by the present owners in the 1980’s to create a wonderful family home ideal for busy modern living.As you approach this fine residence, you are immediately thrown back in time with the timeless weatherboarded façade of this handsome watermill. As the river flows under the former wheel pit, the sound of the flowing water follows you as you enter into a welcoming entrance hall. Through the hall you are greeted by one of the original wooden wallower wheels that adorns the wall as a nod to the property’s past. The ground floor has a thoughtfully designed layout to cater for many types of family dynamics with a clever blend of open plan with clear zoned areas. The living room takes in uninterrupted views of the River Colne with an open fireplace fitted with a log burner creating a warm atmosphere. There is a dining room with exposed timbers and a vaulted ceiling to the first floor and a large second sitting area complete with bar. An enclosed study offers complete privacy for those needing to work from home with views over the river. The kitchen is perfect for those that enjoy culinary pursuits and has been recently renovated to offer a blend of contemporary living with an extensive range of high gloss wall and base units complimented by a quartz worksurface. A breakfast bar provides a pleasant spot to enjoy a coffee and integrated appliances cater for all the everyday needs of a busy home. The utility room offers further space for white goods with a door leading out to the rear garden.As you head up to the staircase you pass the initials of former owners etched into the brickwork, yet another reminder of the rich Heritage of this wonderful property. On the first floor, the property offers a really usable layout with generous bedrooms. The principal bedroom is a stunning space with exposed timbers and wonderful views over open countryside.The principal bedroom has an en-suite and a lovely walk in wardrobe with fitted hanging space. There are four additional bedrooms each enjoying views of countryside and exposed timbers and a luxurious family bathroom fitted with a bath and shower.During the restoration the owners discovered the original steps once used by the mill workers and have carefully restored these for use to access the second floor of the mill. On the second floor is an open landing with vaulted ceiling to exposed roof trusses and would make a lovely seating area for bedroom six which has a high level window allowing for plenty of light to fill the room. A second set of restored steps lead to a loft mezzanine with further steps to a void where there is scope for additional rooms if required. Additional Mill machinery are still located within the loft which would make an interested restoration project for the new owners.The mill is located along a private drive that opens to a wonderful setting of three properties. The attached Mill House is a Georgian residence and complements Chalkney Mill’s façade. Up the lane from the mill is the beautiful ancient woodland of Chalkney Meadows, a favoured spot for locals to enjoy a peaceful stroll through the woodland. The gardens of Chalkney Mill provide a tranquil setting to unwind and enjoy the sounds of the River Colne and visiting wildlife. A patio area extends across the rear of the Mill creating a lovely entertaining area. A gate opens to the formal gardens where you can relax in the summer house. To access the additional acreage, you have to cross the sluice gates, a system that sends water into the picturesque mill pond during times of high water. The mill pond continues to a mill stream that links back to the River Colne further downstream. Once you cross the bridge, you will find two paddocks with a stable block in the second field. In all, the property enjoys around 2.5 acres of private gardens situated in a stunning setting with every changing scenery.Earls Colne is situated in the heart of the Colne Valley which has some of the prettiest countryside in the County with plenty of opportunities for walks and riding.It is well placed for the commuter being within easy reach of Kelvedon Station and Marks Tey stations with the journey to Liverpool Street taking some 50 - 60 minutes. En-route to Kelvedon, one crosses the A120 trunk road which serves Braintree, Dunmow, Stansted Airport and the M11.The market towns of Halstead and Coggeshall are both situated approximately 4 miles away which offer extensive shopping and dining facilities.The region boasts a significant number of secondary and primary schools as well as colleges and nurseries. There are well-renowned private schools within easy reach and some of the country’s leading grammar schools in Colchester and Chelmsford.Electric, Oil, Private Drainage, Mains WaterEntrance HallSitting Room6.53m x 6.23m (21' 5" x 20' 5")Living Room & Dining Area8.81m x 8.66m (28' 11" x 28' 5")Office3.40m x 3.23m (11' 2" x 10' 7")Kitchen/Breakfast Room5.87m x 3.94m (19' 3" x 12' 11")Utility Room4.19m x 2.25m (13' 9" x 7' 5")Ground Floor CloakroomFirst Floor LandingBedroom One5.08m x 4.48m (16' 8" x 14' 8")Walk in Wardrobe2.50m x 1.94m (8' 2" x 6' 4")En-SuiteBedroom Two4.97m x 3.30m (16' 4" x 10' 10")Bedroom Three3.46m x 3.30m (11' 4" x 10' 10")Bedroom Four3.34m x 3.30m (10' 11" x 10' 10")Bedroom Five4.32m x 2.42m (14' 2" x 7' 11")Family BathroomSecond Floor Landing/Study Area6.48m x 2.46m (21' 3" x 8' 1")Bedroom Six6.48m x 2.40m (21' 3" x 7' 10")Loft Storage6.48m x 5.07m (21' 3" x 16' 8")Agents NotePlease note this property is a listed building meaning it is of local or national historical interest. It is important to understand that there may be restrictions on what works can be carried out on the property and listed building consent may be required. There are many mis-understandings surrounding listed buildings therefore we would advise visiting for more information.

complete_description: **fantastic opportunity to take over this two bedroom tenanted property** **investors only**Pleased to bring to market this well presented two double bedroom back to back terrace property that is offered for sale with no onward chain. This superb property has tenants in situ and current rent is £575pcm. The main accommodation is arranged over four floors and comprises of a beautifully decorated lounge, kitchen leading to the cellar and utility room, two double bedrooms and a three piece bathroom suite. There is also parking to the front of the property. Raincliffe Terrace is situated within very easy reach of the city centre with local bus routes running to and from making it as easy commute and motorway links such as the M621, M62 and M1 a short distance away. Book your viewing now to avoid disappointment!Ground FloorWelcomed into the immaculately presented lounge with a window to the front elevation flooding the room with natural lighting. Chimney breast with feature fireplace, high ceilings and radiator. The kitchen is fitted with a range of matching wall and base units with complimentary work surfaces over the stainless steel sink and draining area. Plumbing for washing machine, space for fridge/freezer and integrated gas hob and oven with extractor fan over. Window to the front elevation, door leading to the basement.BasementUseful storage space with separate utility room.First FloorTo the first floor is a carpeted double bedroom with a window facing the front elevation and a radiator below. Space for wardrobes and chest of drawers if desired. The bathroom is fitted with a three piece suite comprising of a bath with shower over, pedestal wash hand basin and low level flush WC. Partially tiled walls, frosted window to the front elevation and radiator. Stairs leading to the second bedroom.Second FloorStairs leading to the second double carpeted bedroom with a dormer window to the front elevation and radiator.Property Ownership InformationTenureFreeholdCouncil Tax BandADisclaimer For Virtual ViewingsSome or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. name: 4 bed property for sale
description: 4 bed property for sale in Stone Hall Road, London N21, selling for £1,200,000 from Absolute Property Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Stone Hall Road, London N21.
complete_description: A substantial four-bedroom family home providing flexible family living, situated on Stone Hall Road, one of the most sought after locations in N21. This property has been refurbished to a high standard throughout and boasts a wealth of quality fixtures, fittings and character in addition to a 27ft x 24ft kitchen/diner/family room with bi folding doors opening to the rear garden. Located within walking distance of Grovelands Park and Winchmore Hill Green with its local shops, buses restaurants and br station. Southgate Circus is also within easy reach with its underground station and multiple shops.Accomodation Comprises:¦Entrance Hall¦Living Room¦Kitchen Diner¦Study¦ Guest Cloakroom¦Storage Room¦Four Bedrooms¦Family Bathroom¦En Suite¦Driveway¦Rear Garden¦Stone Hall Road:This family residence is beautifully presented and boasts light and spacious accommodation. The current owners have lovingly cared for and transformed this property into a stunning, individual family home. Each and every room has been decorated and well-appointed with style and quality. There are four bedrooms to the first floor one with ensuite in addition to a family bathroom. Two of the bedroom’s outlook on to the rear garden. Downstairs the natural light main reception faces the front aspect allowing plenty of light to flow through. Off the hallway is a study, guest cloakroom and walk in storage room (converted garage), in addition you will find a high specification fully integrated German "Veneto" kitchen/diner with granite worktops and bi folding doors taking you out to the secluded garden.It should be noted that the loft area is boarded lending itself very nicely to the next family who may want to convert or augment the roof space into further rooms (subject to the local planning consents and building regulations).Outside:The property is accessed via a driveway with mature shrub borders. The rear garden has been landscaped with large patio and various flower beds with additional seating areaon raised decking and shed to the rear providing a secluded setting.Location:Within walking distance of Grovelands Park and Winchmore Hill Green with its local shops, buses restaurants and br station. Southgate Circus is also within easy reach with its underground station and multiple shops. Easy access to several local highly regarded schools.Entrance Hall:Solid wood flooring, Victorian style radiator, stairs to first floor landing, under stairs storage, doors to living room, kitchen/diner/family room, study, guest wc and walk in storage room housing the boiler.Living Room:Solid wood flooring, fitted log burner, two Victorian style radiators, upvc double glazed bay window to front aspect, coving to ceiling.Study:Upvc double glazed window to side aspect, solid wood flooring.Guest Cloakroom:Comprising of low flush wc, vanity unit hand wash basin with mixer taps, upvc double glazed frosted window to side aspect.Kitchen/Diner/Family Room:Range of eye and base level units with granite work tops, breakfast bar, built in double oven (Siemens), induction hob and extractor, space for American style fridge/freezer, two velux windows, bi folding doors opening to rear garden, door to utility room.Utility Room:Range of eye and base level units, butler sink with mixer taps, plumbing for washing machine, upvc double glazed window to side aspect.Bedroom One:Built in wardrobes, Victorian style radiator, upvc double glazed window to rear aspect, door to en suite.En SuiteComprising of low flush wc, vanity unit hand wash basin with mixer taps, shower cubicle, upvc double glazed frosted window to rear aspect.Bedroom Two:Upvc double glazed bay window to front aspect, two Victorian style radiators, fitted wardrobes and shelving unit.Bedroom Three:Two upvc double glazed windows to front aspect, radiator, fitted wardrobes.Bedroom Four:Radiator, upvc double glazed window to rear aspect.Family Bathroom:Three piece suite comprising of low flush wc, vanity unit hand wash basin with mixer taps, bath with shower unit, upvc double glazed frosted window to side aspect.

These rooms can be versatile according to the needs of the new owners and normally operate as 3 bedrooms and 1 lounge but could equally be 2 bedrooms and 2 lounge. A point to note is the future possibility of creating a loft conversion as properties of this type have large loft spaces capable of creating additional space (with appropriate approvals of course). Externally to the rear the property enjoys some outdoor patio/searing space and a detached garage providing enclosed vehicle storage/parking with additional on-street parking to the front.Immaculately presented throughout, this is an excellent opportunity to acquire a ready to move into home close to all local amenities.Viewing arrangements can be made by contacting the office. description: 1 bed flat for sale in Glenhills Court, Little Glen Road, Glen Parva, Leicester LE2, selling for £155,000 from McCarthy Stone - RESALES. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Glenhills Court, Little Glen Road, Glen Parva, Leicester LE2.
complete_description: Enjoy lunch on us when you take A tour of glenhills court - book now!Beautifully presented one bedroom apartment situated within a popular mccarthy & stone retirement living plus development.Glenhills CourtGlenhills Court is located beside the Grand Union Canal in Glen Parva, just half a mile from the vibrant village of Blaby and four miles from Leicester city centre. This fine collection of age-exclusive apartments is a must-see for those seeking retirement living in Leicestershire.The complex includes one and two bedroom properties, which are spacious, stylish, and offer the benefits of Retirement Living plusGlenhills Court offers great comfort and security, allowing you to enjoy an independent and social retirement, with 24-Hour on-site staffing, secure camera entry systems and 24-Hour emergency call system.Glenhills Court features a selection of social areas, including the homeowners lounge and canal side gardens. The excellent on site restaurant serves meals every day of the year, complete with table service and an adjacent sun terrace for those warm summer evenings.Lifts and wheelchair access make all areas of the complex accessible to everyone.The development has a vibrant, friendly community with a very active Homeowners association. There are a variety of regular weekly activities and events to take part in, should one wish, such as gentle group exercise sessions, book club, film nights and coffee mornings.In addition to the weekly events a number of day excursions are taken throughout the year.When your friends and family wish to visit, they too can enjoy comfort and privacy in the guest suite. The complex sits on the Grand Union Canal, which provides pleasant waterside views as well as the perfect place for a morning stroll.Local AreaGlenhills Court is situated half a mile from Blaby and 1 mile from Wigston. Blaby is well served by local independent traders which include butchers, bakers, chemists, newsagents etc as well as national retail chains. Located within the town centre are a variety of essential services including a bank and the Post Office, a health centre and a dental practice. Leicester City centre is easily accessed by bus with a stop just outside Glenhills Court. The service is regular with stops at the Leicester Royal Infirmary, the De Montfort Hall and all the major Leicester sports grounds. From Glenhills Court one can stroll along the canal tow path. In one direction the tow path takes you to South Wigston or you can veer off on footpaths crossing the nearby River Sence and on to Bouskell Park and beyond. In the other direction the towpath leads to Aylestone Meadows, the River Soar, the Great Central Way, Everards Meadows and eventually to Leicester City Centre. Further afield Glenhills Court is ideally situated to explore the Charnwood Forest around junction 22 of the M1 and in the opposite direction places like Foxton Locks near Market Harborough.Apartment OverviewMcCarthy & Stone Resales are proud to bring to the market this well presented apartment situated on the fourth floor (serviced by a lift). The apartment benefits from spacious rooms and built in wardrobe in the bedroom and has new carpets fitted throughout. *viewings advised*Entrance HallFront door with spy hole leads to a spacious entrance hall - the 24-hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system is located in the hall. description: 2 bed flat for sale in Shaftesbury Avenue, Covent Garden WC2H, selling for £1,100,000 from Greater London Properties. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Shaftesbury Avenue, Covent Garden WC2H.
complete_description: Greater London PresentsA magnificent, modern two bedroom two bathroom fourth floor apartment (with lift), located in the heart of Covent Garden. Set in a stunning block in Shaftesbury Avenue which runs through the heart of the West End.The PropertyExtending over 736 sq. Ft., this luxury apartment is set on the fourth floor (with lift) and features high ceilings, quality wood flooring and floor to ceiling triple glazed windows which bathes the entire property in natural light. The apartment features a magnificent living room with plenty of entertainment and dining space. There is a partially separated bespoke contemporary kitchen with integrated appliances and stylish décor. The principle bedroom boasts full height fitted wardrobes and an immaculate en-suite bathroom with double sink. Second bedroom which could also be used as a bright office space with sliding doors opening into the reception and a stylish family bathroom. The flat is ideal as an investment, pied de terre or owner occupiers.Property LocationThis beautiful building is very well kept and located within the heart of Covent Garden on Shaftesbury Avenue. Well positioned for access to the capital's best in dining, entertainment and shopping. The apartment also offers easy access to the City of London, airports and to many of the world's best universities.It is a short walk from the Covent Garden Piazza and is very well connected in terms of buses and tubes. The nearest Underground stations are Covent Garden (Piccadilly line), Leicester Square (Northern and Piccadilly lines) and Tottenham Court Road (Central and Northern lines, Elizabeth Line).What the Owner Saysi'm in love with this flat. I first rented in the building and when I noticed this flat was for sale I didn't hesitate. Its hypercentral location at the melting point of Soho and Covent Garden allow me to do most of my commutes walking. But leaving the city is easy as all central underground lines are just a short stroll away, including the just opened Elizabeth Line. For me personally it was especially very easy to access the Eurostar in just a few minutes.As the flat is at the backside of the building it is also remarkably calm for its central location. I really appreciated (and financially support) the community-run garden behind the building.The flat is very bright and even though modern the lighting make it a very cosy home. From the bedroom I especially appreciate the view over 'St Giles in the Fields' church, which indeed still is surrounded by lots of open space.What3words ///  faces.nobody.bleatNoticePlease note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

name: 4 bed detached house for sale
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Keswick Road, Orpington, Kent BR6, selling for £1,250,000 from jdm Estate Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Keswick Road, Orpington, Kent BR6.
complete_description: Guide Price £1,250,000 - £1,350,000A rare opportunity to purchase a delightful 1920s detached family home which offers an abundance of charm and character with solid oak beams and joinery which is offered chain free.Guide Price £1,250,000 - £1,350,000Offered chain free, jdm are pleased to offer this rare opportunity to purchase a delightful detached family home built in 1926 by a Mr Elphick as a wedding present for his wife. Purchased in 1994 by our vendors, there have only been three owners in 100 years. The property is situated in a peaceful location within the sought after Knoll area of Orpington and offers spacious accommodation offering an abundance of charm and character with solid oak beams and joinery.On entering the property, there is a spacious entrance hallway and a downstairs wc, in turn giving access to the large sitting room with its feature fireplace, beamed ceiling and multi paned windows overlooking the front aspect and French doors leading out to the rear garden. In addition on the ground floor can be found the dining room to the front with a traditional feature fireplace, the study and playroom/third reception room which has a door leading out to the garden. There is also an additional guest wc. The kitchen overlooks the rear garden and is fitted with oak fronted units and benefits from quarry tiled flooring. From here there is a door giving access to the utility room and a further door leading out to the rear garden.From the hallway, the character staircase takes you up to the enormous landing on the first floor with two storage cupboards and windows overlooking the rear garden. The spacious master bedroom measuring 21’ x 18’ benefits from being double aspect with windows to the rear and a square bay window overlooking the front plus an en suite bathroom. There are a further three good size bedrooms two with large eaves storage cupboards and a family bathroom on this floor.Externally, is the well maintained bright and sunny west facing garden with a paved patio area at the immediate rear of the property leading on to the expansive lawn which is surrounded by mature shrubs, trees and bushes. There is access along both sides of the property to the front and the single detached garage which is approached via a carriage driveway. There is ample scope to extend both to the side and rear STPP.Orpington station with its fast and frequent services to many London termini can be found within a 10 minute walk.We would strongly recommend an internal viewing to fully appreciate this charming family home.

name: 4 bed terraced house for sale
description: 4 bed terraced house for sale in High Street, Marshfield SN14, selling for £1,000,000 from Hamptons - Bath Sales. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in High Street, Marshfield SN14.
complete_description: This delightful home has too many character features to list here and can only be appreciated by inspection, the beamed dining hall with its flag stone floor leads to the rear lobby and kitchen along with the sitting room to the side and stairs that descend to a front cellar. This is currently arranged as a home cinema with exposed stone wall, tiled floor and vent to the front. The charming sitting room is also beamed with fitted cabinetry, an Inglenook and wood burner. To the side of the fireplace is a door to the enclosed stairs that lead to the principal bedroom suite. At the rear of the cottage, a lobby opens to the rear garden and also the recently refitted luxury, hand finished kitchen. With a comprehensive range of units with recess for a Range, integrated appliances, table space and stairs leading both up and down to a second cellar. Used as a gym with a tiled floor, this is an excellent multi-purpose space. Off the kitchen is a coats lobby and cloakroom. A utility room lies to the rear with cabinets matching the kitchen, and a cupboard for stacked appliances. The principal bedroom is vaulted with exposed beams, eaves storage as well as built-in cupboards and a fully tiled en-suite shower room. The rear bedroom wing, off the kitchen, comprises a split level landing, three bedrooms, one of which has an en-suite shower cubicle in addition to a half tiled family bathroom. With a claw foot bath and a separate shower cubicle, this is another room that showcases the quality fittings of this fine home.OutsideThe rear garden has been thoughtfully landscaped with a paved terrace and steps up to a level lawn, bound by flower and shrub beds with young trees, pergola and a brick path to the rear gate. There is a double width car port with gated access at the rear via Back Lane. Planning has been approved for a garden room to be added to this structure. There is also a side garden to the path that leads to the High Street.SituationThe property is located within the heart of this convenient and much admired Cotswold village, with level walking access of day to day facilities. Being a Conservation Area, the unspoilt High Street is made up of predominantly period homes and essential amenities such as a village store and post office, tea room and newsagents. There is a popular and much admired primary school, in addition to the excellent schools in Bath on offer. A choice of public houses as well as the village church and gp surgery are all located in this thriving community. Approximately eight miles north of Bath, the A420 provides easy access to Bristol and Chippenham with rail links to London Paddington and the M4 Motorway at Junction 18 is just to the north.Additional InformationServices: All mains connected. Council Tax Band D.Period CharmSplit Level LayoutHigh Quality FittingsCentral LocationEnclosed GardensCovered Off Road Parking

complete_description: Pont Pentre Residential Park is located just off the A470. Just 15 minutes from the capital city centre of Cardiff. The park benefits from several bus stops within 300 meters of the park entrance with regular bus services to Cardiff, Bridgend, Barry and Newport. Cardiff is only 9 miles away for those who love to shop and visit the historic buildings and castle. It is also the centre for sports and the arts with the Principality Stadium and the St Davids Centre amongst the attractions. Only 11 miles from the Pont Pentre development is the newly developed Cardiff Bay area with the National Assembly buildings, museums, theatres and entertainment, walks and views, bistros and bars. Cardiff Airport is also only 7 miles away. name: 4 bed country house for sale
description: 4 bed country house for sale in Rashleigh Vale, Truro TR1, selling for £1,000,000 from Lewis Haughton Estate Agents. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Rashleigh Vale, Truro TR1.
complete_description: Lewis Haughton is extremely excited to market this exceptional detached executive residence tucked away in a private, non-estate location just minutes from the city centre, bus routes and local schooling. Surrounded by mature plants, trees and shrubs sits Rashleigh House which is tastefully designed and built approximately 40 years ago by a well-respected property developer.Internally the property offers immaculately presented spacious and versatile living accommodation with four double bedrooms complimented by an ensuite bathroom to the master bedroom, a family bathroom as well as a downstairs cloakroom. A stunning entrance reception finished in American Cherry Hardwood provides access to the living room with conservatory off, study/bedroom five and the spacious open plan kitchen, breakfast and dining room. Concluding the ground floor is a rear hallway with access to the gardens, utility room with internal door to the double garage. A wonderful Cherry Hardwood staircase with glass panelling leads to the galleried landing where four double bedrooms are served by a family bathroom. The master bedroom benefits from an ensuite bathroom and high quality built in wardrobes with matching drawers. Built-in wardrobes are also found in bedrooms two and three. Finally, a second staircase rises from the rear hallway to a superb 28ft x 26ft games & cinema room. This part of the property could quite easily be utilised as a separate letting unit, self-contained annexe or just for further bedrooms/living accommodation, if required.Outside, to the front is private driveway parking for a number of vehicles as well as a double garage. Access is enjoyed around the entire house to the main gardens located to the south side maximising the daily sunshine. A recently fitted composite decked sun terrace is found to the rear accessed directly off the kitchen/dining room which overlooks the gardens & wooded views beyond.LocationThe city of Truro is the retail and commercial centre of Cornwall, with the famous Cathedral lying at its heart. The city offers a unique mix of independent shops and multiples as well as an excellent collection of art galleries, bars, restaurants, night clubs, cinema, The Hall for Cornwall and the Royal Cornwall Museum. The city is steeped in history and features many wonderful Georgian terraced streets which are rivalled only in the west by Bath. There are also a number of fine municipal gardens including Boscawen Park and Victoria Gardens, which have in the past won many awards in the Britain In Bloom competition. The city also lies at the centre of the Cornish transport network and has a mainline station to London Paddington.Front approachComposite front door to:Entrance receptionFinished in American Cherry Hardwood flooring with feature stone wall. Oak door to dining room. Stunning hardwood staircase with glass panelling complemented with polished chrome. Steps rise to an inner hallway again finished in American Cherry Hardwood with radiator cupboard housing hot water cylinder and oak doors to bedroom five/office and kitchen/breakfast room.Living room27' 1" x 13' 11" (8.26m x 4.24m) Spacious light and airy room with dual aspect double glazed windows. Two radiators. Recessed gas fire with slate hearth and surround. Double glazed sliding doors to conservatory.Conservatory16' 4" x 10' 2" (4.98m x 3.10m) Superb Victorian-style conservatory with multiple double glazed windows with pitch glass ceiling with inset spotlights. French doors open to side gardens.Bedroom five/office10' 0" x 10' 0" (3.05m x 3.05m) Double glazed window to rear aspect. Radiator. High-quality built-in office furniture to include a corner desk complemented by a number of built-in cupboards and drawers.Open plan kitchen/breakfast room23' 9" x 12' 6" (7.24m x 3.81m)Kitchen areaSuperb modern fitted kitchen with a number of soft-close and built-in wall and base units with under cabinet lighting and inset spotlights to plinths all accompanied by granite worktops. Inset Siemens oven and microwave/combi over. Pull-out pantry. Built-in dishwasher with space for large American-style fridge freezer. Inset hob with extractor hood above. Inset butler-style sink with mixer tap, drainer and waste disposal. Attractive brick archway leading through to:Breakfast roomDouble glazed window to rear aspect. Double glazed door leading to front driveway. Radiator. Inset spotlights. Door to rear hallway.Dining room14' 0" x 13' 4" (4.27m x 4.06m) This spacious dining room is also open plan to the kitchen benefiting from double glazed French doors to a recently fitted composite decked sun terrace. description: 2 bed detached house for sale in Braunton Road, Ashford, Barnstaple EX31, selling for £40,000 from Bond Oxborough Phillips - Barnstaple. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Braunton Road, Ashford, Barnstaple EX31.
complete_description:
Bond Oxborough Phillips are proud to introduce a fantastic opportunity for you to acquire this fantastic holiday home at Tarka Holiday Park. It is perfectly located between Barnstaple and Braunton and only a stone's throw from local beaches. Whether it’s a holiday home for you and your family here in sunny Devon, or you’re an investor looking for your next purchase, this is truly one you don’t want to miss out on.This fantastic holiday home provides a welcoming and bright Lounge / Kitchen / Diner, a well-proportioned double Bedroom with a toilet suite, a single Bedroom and a modernised 3-piece suite Shower Room.The outside of the property provides 1 allocated parking space to the side of the property and a sunny aspect composite decking.Barnstaple Town Centre, the historic and regional centre of North Devon, is surrounded by beautiful countryside and some of the area’s best beaches. As the commercial centre of the region, the town centre offers a variety of banking, schooling and recreational facilities including a theatre, cinema, leisure centre, restaurants and the North Devon District Hospital. The vibrant town combines modern shopping amenities with a bustling market atmosphere.The A361 North Devon Link Road provides convenient access to the M5 motorway network and beyond. Exmoor National Park and North Devon’s famous surfing beaches at Croyde, Putsborough, Saunton (also with Championship golf course) and Woolacombe are all within about half an hour by car. The nearest International airports are at Bristol and Exeter.

Directions
Head north-west out of Barnstaple along Braunton Road (B3149). Proceed along this road until reaching the dual carriageway. Take the right hand turning into Tarka Holiday Park. Visitor parking spaces will easily be found on your left hand side.Lounge / Diner (11' 8" x 11' 8")UPVC double glazed windows. Electric fire. Fitted carpet, radiator, power point, TV point.Kitchen (7' 2" x 7' 2")A bright fitted Kitchen with matching floor and wall units and stainless steel sink basin. Built-in 4-ring gas hob and oven. Space for fridge and freezer. Power points, vinyl flooring. UPVC double glazed windows. UPVC double glazed obscure door to outside decking.Bedroom 1 (11' 8" x 8' 1")A double Bedroom with UPVC double glazed window. Built-in double wardrobe. Fitted carpet, power points, TV point, radiator.En-Suite (4' 8" x 4' 2")WC and sink basin. Heated towel rail, vinyl flooring. UPVC double glazed obscure window.Bedroom 2 (8' 1" x 5' 9")A single Bedroom with UPVC double glazed window. Single built-in storage. Fitted carpet, radiator, power points.Shower Room (7' 2" x 4' 9")3-piece suite comprising shower enclosure, WC and sink basin. Heated towel rail, vinyl flooring. UPVC double glazed obscure windows.OutsideTo the side of the property is an allocated parking space for 1 vehicle. There is a storage / utility space for a tumble dryer and washing machine. Decking to the side of the property.Useful Information• The Holiday Home can be used during the Park's holiday season which is for 11.5 months of the year.• It is for holiday occupation only.• You will be buying the holiday home, but not the pitch.• The pitch remains in the ownership of the site owner who is responsible for maintaining and managing the site.• You will be charged separately for water, gas and electricity which the site owner will supply directly to your holiday home.• Your pitch agreement will be protected by the Mobile Homes Act 1983, which regulates the contract between you and the site owner and sets out the parties respective rights and obligations.• An Energy Performance Certificate is not required.Fees• Ground Rent - £5445 per annum.• Pitch Agreement is for 20 years with 3 years expired.

complete_description: Beautiful 7.5 acre parcel of woodland in a desirable location.The woodland is accessed via a private right of way along a track leading from Sutton Row. A public footpath runs along this track and along the northern boundary of the parcels being marketed.Lot 1 of the woodland comprises approximately 7.5 acres in total, located along the southern edge of Whitmarsh Wood. Situated on a north facing gently sloping embankment on free draining slightly acid loamy soils.The woodland comprises a mixture of native deciduous species including mature Beech, Oak, Birch and Sycamore interspersed by mature Holy trees, rich in flora and fauna, and a haven for local wildlife. In the spring, the woodland floor becomes a sea of blue as the bluebells come out.The woodland lies within the Cranborne Chase and West Wiltshire Downs Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, classified as Ancient and Semi-Natural Woodland and covered by a Tree Preservation Order. Further details are available from the vendors agents.The woodland is located in a beautiful part of the Nadder Valley to the north of the A30, between Salisbury and Shaftesbury. Found to the west of Sutton Row, and close to a number of popular villages including; Sutton Mandeville, Tisbury, Chilmark and Fovant.Lying close to the Wiltshire/Dorset border the woodland lies in a highly regarded and desirable area, within the Cranborne Chase Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, known not only for its stunning countryside with excellent walking and riding but also for the number of wonderful pubs and local facilities.From Salisbury head west towards Shaftesbury on the A30. Pass through Fovant and after just over 1.5 miles, take the turning right sign posted to Chicksgrove, Sutton Row and Sutton Mandeville. Then take the first left on to Lagpond Lane, continue along this road round a sharp right hand bend. Drop down the hill, pass some farm buildings on your left hand side. The entrance of the track to the woodland can then be found on your left hand side.Nearest Postcode: SP3 5NQ

Ft of accommodation complete with period features, quality finishes throughout and wonderful light with a favourable East and West aspect. The property has been lovingly maintained and well laid out with a spacious open plan reception room and dining area with views to the beautiful gardens below. The bedrooms are spacious, and the master bedroom has a large walk-in wardrobe, which could be altered to be come and end-suite with suitable permissions. Canonbury station is within easy reach with Clissold Park, Clissold Leisure Centre and the renowned shops, restaurants and cafes of Newington Green and Stoke Newington Church Street only a walk away. Newington Green, Highbury Quadrant, St. Joan of Arc rc, Betty Layward, and Grasmere Primary Schools are rated Good. Highbury Fields Secondary, Gillespie Primary and St John's Highbury Vale CofE Primary are rated as outstanding and within 0.5miles.

complete_description: Retirement apartment for the over 55S!A fantastic one bedroom first floor apartment located in the desirable Kingsdale Court which is warden assisted and offers a 24 hour care line for extra peace of mind. The added benefit of lifts to each floor will certainly prove handy. With the town centre and transport links close, you can pop to the shops in a matter of minutes.For those interested in socialising and interacting there is a lovely communal lounge where residents can sit and relax as well as socialise. There are also many functions that take place arranged by the residents. There is also communal laundry rooms.Offered exclusively with no chain.Key termsChatham is famous for its Naval connection’s, hosting one of the Royal Navy’s main facilities for hundreds of years until it’s closure in 1984. Since the closure the former site, now known as St Mary’s Island, has been transformed and boasts a new retail outlet centre, bars, cafe’s, restaurants, gym and cinema to compliment the harbour and vast array of riverside housing. Part of the original naval history has also been preserved through the Historic Dockyard Trust, which provides an insight into past traditions. The Pentagon shopping centre and high street offer everything that you will need with a wide range of stores. Chatham is a commuter’s dream. High Speed rail links to Stratford International in just over 30 minutes or St Pancras International in just over 38 minutes. London Victoria is also accessible in just over 52 minutes. Trips to the continent are also within easy reach via the Eurostar, which departs from nearby Ebbsfleet. In any part of the town you are never too far from road links, the A2 and M2 are easily accessible in under 5 miles. With the M20 and M25 approximately 10 miles away. Chatham and near-by Rochester offer a fantastic range of primary and secondary schools, as well as the University of Greenwich, Kent and The Creative Arts.Living Room (18' 1" x 10' 6" (5.5m x 3.2m))Kitchen (5' 11" x 8' 3" (1.8m x 2.51m))Bedroom (14' 9" x 8' 6" (4.5m x 2.6m))Shower Room

complete_description: A croft tenancy is an agricultural unit which is located in one of the crofting counties or specially designated areas usually consisting of a small area of land plus grazing rights in an area of common grazings shared with a number of other crofts in the local area.Badcaul is in a stunning rural area of scattered crofts and houses. The land extends from the road to the shore of Little Loch Broom and enjoys wonderful views across the loch and to Beinn Ghobhlach beyond. The remaining croft land (No. 6) extends to approx. 1.96 hectares (4.84 acres) and has a share the common grazing.Directions: Travelling west on the A835, turn left at the Braemore Junction on to the A832, continue for 18 miles. When you see the sign for Badcaul there is a post box on the right, this is where Croft 8 begins.

name: 4 bed detached house for sale
description: 4 bed detached house for sale in Rayleigh Road, Harrogate HG2, selling for £1,000,000 from Myrings Estate Agents Ltd. See property details on Zoopla or browse all our range of properties in Rayleigh Road, Harrogate HG2.
complete_description: We are pleased to present this delightful 1930s detached home, which has been substantially updated and extended whilst retaining its original character. This represents an excellent opportunity on one of the most attractive and highly sought-after roads on the south side of Harrogate’s Stray, within very short walking distance of Hornbeam Park railway station, as well as the town centre and highly rated schools. Fronted by an attractive and private lawned garden, with block paved driveway providing ample parking for multiple vehicles, as well as a detached garage, this family home opens to a spacious reception hall with guest w/c and stylish wooden flooring that extends into the bay-fronted sitting room, which is arranged around an open fireplace and overlooks the front garden.To the rear, the open-plan extended living space incorporates a recently updated shaker style kitchen with quartz work surfaces, bespoke circular breakfast bar, integral appliances appropriate for a large family, and an island between the dining area and kitchen.The room flows around to the spacious dining area under the large glass atrium which floods the space with natural light, and into the cosy snug lounge with log burning stove.The side extension features a dual-aspect dedicated home office/study with fitted furniture which overlooks the front and back gardens and French doors that open out to the rear garden. If desired this could easily be converted to a playroom or further accommodation.The open-plan dining area looks out through floor to ceiling windows and separate French doors to the attractive, secluded garden which features a stone flagged patio with westerly aspect to take in the afternoon and evening sun. This steps down to a well maintained lawn which is flanked by established planted boundaries and a summer house.Adjoining the kitchen is a separate utility room, featuring in-built coat and shoe storage, as well as additional cupboard units and dedicated space for washer and dryer. This also provides an additional, practical side entrance from the driveway.To the first floor, the central landing branches to a fully tiled house bathroom with under-floor heating and four well-proportioned bedrooms. The main bedroom with bay window overlooks the rear garden and has a stylish en-suite shower room. The other three bedrooms all feature in-built storage. The property also benefits from a large loft space with ladder access for storage and extension potential.The detached garage provides further storage or additional parking.EPC Rating: DLocationRayleigh Road is a highly desirable address close to Harrogate's town centre and only minutes walk from the 200 acre Stray Parkland. The town offers many attractions such as boutique shopping, a range of fine restaurants and bars and excellent leisure facilities. The town is also renowned for its reputable schools for all ages which are all within a short commute. Transport links are most accessible with the train line running to the main stations at York and Leeds from the town centre or more conveniently Hornbeam Park station which is only a five minute walk away, the A1M linking into the national motorway network only 8 miles away, and Leeds Bradford International Airport a mere twenty minutes drive.GardenFully enclosed, private rear garden mainly laid to lawn with established planted boundaries and a choice of stone flagged seating areas along with a timber summer house.Parking - On DriveBlock set gated driveway large enough for multiple vehicles in front of the detached garage.

complete_description: The Property: This substantial four bedroom detached family home is extremely well presented throughout and is situated within a peaceful cul-de-sac just moments from the finest local schooling, St Albans City centre and the mainline station. The property occupies a tranquil corner plot with beautifully landscaped gardens and offers excellent scope to extend, subject to the usual consents.Description: This impressive detached, four bedroom executive home offers spacious accommodation in excellent decorative order throughout. This peaceful cul-de-sac has a wonderful community spirit and is just over a mile from St Albans City centre and mainline station.The spacious accommodation includes a welcoming entrance hall which leads to a light and bright living room with box windows to the front aspect. There is a useful study with high speed fibre broadband, a downstairs cloakroom and separate dining room. The generous kitchen is well appointed with a number of modern appliances and storage units. Additionally, there is a beautiful conservatory with stunning views of the manicured rear garden.To the first floor there are four double bedrooms, with the principal benefiting from a modern en suite bathroom. A stylish family bathroom completes this wonderful level of the house.The property is positioned next to open countryside with a paved driveway that leads to a double garage and an enclosed, very private garden to the rear which can be accessed via a side gate. There is additional off-street parking for multiple vehicles, solar panels on the roof and an alarm system.Council Tax Band: G £3,330.45 (2022/2023)Location: Beech Bottom is a popular location on the north-west side of St Albans and is situated close to local schooling, transport links and is a short stroll to both the city centre and mainline station. The beautiful green open space of Batchwood Park is just a stone's throw away.

complete_description: Buying this property with a Home for Life Plan discount.This property is offered at a reduced price for people aged over 60 through Homewise's Home for Life Plan. Through the Home for Life Plan, anyone aged over sixty can purchase a lifetime lease on this property which discounts the price from its full market value. The size of the discount you are entitled to depends on your age, personal circumstances and property criteria and could be anywhere between 8.5% and 59% from the property’s full market value. The above price is for guidance only. It’s based on our average discount and would be the estimated price payable by a 69-year-old single male. As such, the price you would pay could be higher or lower than this figure.For more information or a personalised quote, just give us a call. Alternatively, if you are under 60 or would like to purchase this property without a Home for Life Plan at its full market price of £200,000, please contact J W Wood.Property DescriptionAvailable with no onward chain, this well presented and extended three bed semi detached is situated in a popular area of Belmont, and is an deal purchase for first time buyers or growing families.With the benefit of gas fired central heating through a combi boiler and double glazing throughout, the properties floorplan consists; porch, entrance hall with stairs to the first floor, good sized kitchen/breakfast room with door to the side of the property, open living room through into the dining room, then onto the extension which has a additional sitting area which would make an ideal playroom or home office, with french doors to the rear garden. To the first floor there is a modern family bathroom and three bedrooms, with two of the bedrooms featuring built in sliding door wardrobes for ample storage. To the rear of the property is a low maintenance garden decorated with hedges and bushes, laid with pebbles and paving slabs. The garden is subject to a fence being erected to restore it back to its original size. To the front of the property is a drive for multiple cars to park off street which also leads to a detached garage.The popular residential location of Carrville is within easy reach of local shops, schools, public library and other facilities and amenities which are available within Carrville as well as nearby Belmont. Carrville is situated approximately 3 miles from Durham City Centre. It is well placed for commuting purposes being just off the A(690) Durham to Sunderland Highway which in turn offers access to the A1(M) Motorway Interchange.Council Tax Band- CAgents Note:This property is subject to probate.The garden boundary runs across to the rear of the garage.The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. All interested parties must verify accuracy and your solicitor must verify tenure/lease information, fixtures & fittings and, where the property has been extended/converted, planning/building regulation consents. All dimensions are approximate and quoted for guidance only as are floor plans which are not to scale and their accuracy cannot be confirmed. Reference to appliances and/or services does not imply that they are necessarily in working order or fit for the purpose. Suitable as a retirement home.
